original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni rtag ces bya bar shes pa mi 'jug /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni rtag ces bya bar shes pa mi 'jug /
translated: Moreover, the Mahayana of bodhisattva great beings does not engage in the cognition of ‘permanent’ or

original: mi rtag ces bya ba dang / bde zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba dang / bdag ces bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya ba dang / zhi zhes bya ba dang / ma zhi zhes bya ba dang / stong zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: mi rtag ces bya ba dang / bde zhes bya ba dang / sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba dang / bdag ces bya ba dang / bdag med ces bya ba dang / zhi zhes bya ba dang / ma zhi zhes bya ba dang / stong zhes bya ba dang /
translated: ‘impermanent,’ ‘happy’ or ‘suffering,’ ‘self’ or ‘selfless,’ ‘peaceful’ or ‘not peaceful,’ ‘empty’ or

original: mi stong zhes bya ba dang / mtshan ma yod ces bya ba dang / mtshan ma med ces bya ba dang / smon pa yod ces bya ba dang / smon pa med ces bya bar shes pa mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: mi stong zhes bya ba dang / mtshan ma yod ces bya ba dang / mtshan ma med ces bya ba dang / smon pa yod ces bya ba dang / smon pa med ces bya bar shes pa mi 'jug ste /
translated: ‘not empty,’ ‘with signs’ or ‘signless,’ or ‘having aspirations’ or ‘having no aspirations.’

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po yin te /
analyzed: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po yin te /
translated: that is the Mahayana of bodhisattva great beings, and it is not apprehended.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no //
translated: In this way, the bodhisattva mahāsattva has set out in the Great Vehicle.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems @198b dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'das pa'i dus la shes pa mi 'jug /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems @198b dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'das pa'i dus la shes pa mi 'jug /
translated: further, the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva mahāsattva does not engage with knowledge of the past,

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus la shes pa mi 'jug /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus la shes pa mi 'jug /
translated: does not engage with knowledge of the future,

original: da ltar byung ba'i dus la shes pa'ang mi 'jug la /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i dus la shes pa'ang mi 'jug la /
translated: and does not engage with knowledge of the present.

original: de dus gsum po dag mi shes pa'ang ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: de dus gsum po dag mi shes pa'ang ma yin pa ste /
translated: However, it is not that it does not know the three times.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po yin te /
analyzed: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po yin te /
translated: that is the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva mahāsattva, and it is by way of not apprehending anything.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no //
translated: In this way, the bodhisattva mahāsattva has set out in the Great Vehicle.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'dod pa'i khams su shes pa mi 'jug /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'dod pa'i khams su shes pa mi 'jug /
translated: Moreover, the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva great beings does not engage with the knowledge of the desire realm,

original: gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams su shes pa mi 'jug la /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams su shes pa mi 'jug la /
translated: nor does it engage with the knowledge of the form realm or the formless realm.

original: de 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams mi shes pa'ang ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: de 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams mi shes pa'ang ma yin pa ste /
translated: Yet it is not the case that it does not know the desire realm, the form realm, or the formless realm.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po yin te /
analyzed: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po yin te /
translated: that is the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva great beings, and it is so by way of not apprehending anything.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no //🔽tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no // tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Thus, Venerable Śāriputra, the bodhisattva great beings are correctly engaged in the Great Vehicle.

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'jig rten pa'i chos rnams la shes pa mi 'jug /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni 'jig rten pa'i chos rnams la shes pa mi 'jug /
translated: Moreover, Venerable Śāriputra, the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva great beings does not engage with the knowledge of mundane dharmas,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams dang / zag pa dang bcas pa @199a *//🔽rnams dang / zag pa med pa rnams dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams la'ang shes pa mi 'jug la /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams dang / zag pa dang bcas pa @199a *// rnams dang / zag pa med pa rnams dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams la'ang shes pa mi 'jug la /
translated: the mundane and supramundane,🔽the contaminated and uncontaminated, and the conditioned and unconditioned.

original: de 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams mi shes pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: de 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams mi shes pa'ang ma yin /
translated: But it is not the case that they do not know the mundane and supramundane,

original: zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams mi shes pa'ang ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams mi shes pa'ang ma yin pa ste /
translated: the contaminated and uncontaminated, and the conditioned and uncontaminated.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po yin te /
analyzed: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po yin te /
translated: this is the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva great beings, and it is not apprehended.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa yin no //
translated: In this way, the bodhisattva great beings correctly engage with the Great Vehicle.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bus /
translated: Then the venerable Śāriputra said to the bodhisattva great being Avalokiteśvara:

original: tshe dang ldan pa byams ma'i bu gang po la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa byams ma'i bu gang po la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: He said this to the venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra:

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: “Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: ci tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la yang dag par gnas pa zhes bya /
analyzed: ci tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la yang dag par gnas pa zhes bya /
translated: to what extent is a bodhisattva mahāsattva said to be correctly abiding in the Great Vehicle?”

original: gang pos smras pa /
analyzed: gang pos smras pa /
translated: Pūrṇa said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /
translated: here a bodhisattva mahāsattva practicing the perfection of wisdom

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par gnas la /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par gnas la /
translated: correctly abides in the perfection of generosity.

original: de sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'ang mi dmigs /
analyzed: de sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'ang mi dmigs /
translated: He does not apprehend the perfection of generosity,

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang mi dmigs /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang mi dmigs /
translated: he does not apprehend a bodhisattva,

original: len pa po'ang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: len pa po'ang mi dmigs te /
translated: and he does not apprehend a recipient.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par @199b gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par @199b gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: In that way, a bodhisattva mahāsattva is said to correctly abide in the perfection of generosity by way of not apprehending anything.”

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par gnas pa'ang de bzhin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par gnas pa'ang de bzhin no //
translated: He is also one who is correctly established in the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, and the perfection of concentration.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par gnas la /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par gnas la /
translated: here a bodhisattva great being practicing the perfection of wisdom is correctly established in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang mi dmigs /
analyzed: de shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang mi dmigs /
translated: He does not apprehend the perfection of wisdom,

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang mi dmigs /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang mi dmigs /
translated: he does not apprehend a bodhisattva,

original: yid la byed pa'ang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: yid la byed pa'ang mi dmigs te /
translated: and he does not apprehend attention.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la yang dag par gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: in that way a bodhisattva great being is said to be correctly established in the perfection of wisdom by way of not apprehending anything.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems ma 'dres pas bsgom pa rnam par gzhig pa'i phyir nang stong pa nyid bsgom ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems ma 'dres pas bsgom pa rnam par gzhig pa'i phyir nang stong pa nyid bsgom ste /
translated: “Moreover, Venerable Śāriputra, bodhisattva great beings, with a mind endowed with the knowledge of path aspects, cultivate the emptiness of internal phenomena in order to destroy cultivation.

original: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bsgom mo //
analyzed: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bsgom mo //
translated: And they cultivate that by way of not apprehending anything.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems ma 'dres pa dag gis bsgom pa rnam par gzhig pa'i phyir dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du bsgom ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems ma 'dres pa dag gis bsgom pa rnam par gzhig pa'i phyir dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du bsgom ste /
translated: With a mind endowed with the knowledge of path aspects, they cultivate the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena, the emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of great extent, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena, the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, the emptiness of infinite space, the emptiness of infinite consciousness, the emptiness of nothing whatsoever, the emptiness of neither perception nor nonperception, the emptiness of essential nature, the emptiness of all phenomena, the emptiness of intrinsic defining characteristics, the emptiness of nonobservation, the emptiness of nonentities, and the emptiness of the essential nature of nonentities.

original: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sgom mo //
analyzed: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sgom mo //
translated: And they cultivate that by way of not apprehending anything.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la yang dag par gnas pa zhes @200a *//
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la yang dag par gnas pa zhes @200a *//
translated: in that way, Venerable Śāriputra, bodhisattva great beings are said to be correctly established in the Great Vehicle.

original: bya'o // tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: bya'o // tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems ma 'dres pa dag gis bsgom pa rnam par gzhig pa'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun bsgom ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems ma 'dres pa dag gis bsgom pa rnam par gzhig pa'i phyir byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun bsgom ste /
translated: Moreover, in order to destroy the cultivation of the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening with a bodhisattva great being’s unmixed thoughts endowed with the knowledge of all aspects, they cultivate the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening.

original: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sgom mo //
analyzed: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sgom mo //
translated: And they cultivate them in a way that does not apprehend anything.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems ma 'dres pa dag gis bsgom pa rnam par gzhig pa'i phyir stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems ma 'dres pa dag gis bsgom pa rnam par gzhig pa'i phyir stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom ste /
translated: In order to destroy the cultivation of the emptiness, signless, and wishless meditative stabilizations with a bodhisattva great being’s unmixed thoughts endowed with the knowledge of all aspects, they cultivate the emptiness, signless, and wishless meditative stabilizations.

original: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sgom mo //
analyzed: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sgom mo //
translated: And they cultivate them in a way that does not apprehend anything.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems ma 'dres pa dag gis bsgom pa rnam par gzhig pa'i phyir stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag bsgom ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems ma 'dres pa dag gis bsgom pa rnam par gzhig pa'i phyir stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag bsgom ste /
translated: In order to destroy the cultivation of the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, up to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, he cultivates them with a mind endowed with the knowledge of all aspects, without mixing them in.

original: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sgom mo //
analyzed: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis sgom mo //
translated: And he cultivates them in such a way that he does not apprehend anything.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la yang dag par gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la yang dag par gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: thus it is that a bodhisattva great being is said to be well situated in the Great Vehicle.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can gyi khams dmigs su med pa'i phyir /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sems can gyi khams dmigs su med pa'i phyir / 'di lta ste /
translated: further, a bodhisattva great being, because of the nonapprehension of the realm of beings,

original: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba de ni tha snyad tsam du zad par shes so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba de ni tha snyad tsam du zad par shes so //
translated: knows that this so-called bodhisattva is just a name.

original: gzugs dmigs su med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs dmigs su med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of the nonapprehension of form,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: knows that this so-called bodhisattva is just a name.

original: gzugs @200b zhes bya ba de'ang ming tsam du zad do //
analyzed: gzugs @200b zhes bya ba de'ang ming tsam du zad do //
translated: Form is also just a name.

original: rnam par shes pa'i bar du dmigs su med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i bar du dmigs su med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because consciousness is not apprehended,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is just a name.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba de ni ming tsam du zad do //🔽mig dmigs su med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba de ni ming tsam du zad do // mig dmigs su med pa'i phyir /
translated: Feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are just names.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Because the eyes are not apprehended,

original: mig ces bya ba de ni ming tsam du zad do //🔽yid dmigs su med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mig ces bya ba de ni ming tsam du zad do // yid dmigs su med pa'i phyir /
translated: it is just a name.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Up to: Because the mental faculty is not apprehended,

original: yid ces bya ba'i bar de ni ming tsam du zad do //
analyzed: yid ces bya ba'i bar de ni ming tsam du zad do //
translated: it is just a name.

original: khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /
analyzed: khams rnams dang / skye mched rnams dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun dang / stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang /
translated: The constituents, the sense fields, dependent origination, the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyang de bzhin no //
translated: and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are also like that.

original: nang stong pa nyid dmigs su med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid dmigs su med pa'i phyir /
translated: because inner emptiness is non-apprehensible,

original: 'di lta ste /🔽nang stong pa nyid ces bya ba de ni ming tsam du zad do //
analyzed: 'di lta ste / nang stong pa nyid ces bya ba de ni ming tsam du zad do //
translated: it is just a word.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dmigs su med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dmigs su med pa'i phyir /
translated: because emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities is non-apprehensible,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar de ni ming tsam du zad do //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar de ni ming tsam du zad do //
translated: up to emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities is just a word.🔽because the buddhadharmas are non-apprehensible,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos dmigs su med pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams zhes bya ba de ni ming tsam du zad do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos dmigs su med pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams zhes bya ba de ni ming tsam du zad do //
translated: it is just a word.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' dmigs su med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' dmigs su med pa'i phyir /
translated: because the very limit of reality is non-apprehensible,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is just a word.🔽because thusness, the true nature of dharmas, the dharma-constituent, the establishment of dharmas, the certification of dharmas, the very limit of reality, and the inconceivable are non-apprehensible,

original: de bzhin nyid dang / chos nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes bya ba de ni ming tsam du zad do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang / chos nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' zhes bya ba de ni ming tsam du zad do //
translated: it is just a word.

original: sangs rgyas dmigs su med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dmigs su med pa'i phyir /
translated: because the buddhas are non-apprehensible,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is just a word.

original: byang chub dang / sangs rgyas zhes bya ba @201a *//
analyzed: byang chub dang / sangs rgyas zhes bya ba @201a *//
translated: because awakening and buddha are non-apprehensible,🔽it is just a word.

original: de ni ming tsam du zad do //
analyzed: de ni ming tsam du zad do //
translated: It is just a name.

original: zhes bya bar shes te /
analyzed: zhes bya bar shes te /
translated: In this way,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Venerable Śāriputra,

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la yang dag par gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la yang dag par gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattva is said to be correctly situated in the Great Vehicle.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /🔽gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mngon par shes pa rnams yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po mngon par shes pa rnams yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir sems dang po bskyed pa nas bzung ste /
translated: “Moreover, Venerable Śāriputra,

original: byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug gi bar du sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi snying po la 'dug gi bar du sems can rnams yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: the bodhisattva mahāsattva, in order to perfect the superknowledges, from the first production of the thought of enlightenment until seated at the seat of enlightenment, brings beings to maturity.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro'o //
translated: He goes from buddhafield to buddhafield.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing na gang la gang 'os pa'i mchod pa dang / rim gro bya ba dag gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsti stang du byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing na gang la gang 'os pa'i mchod pa dang / rim gro bya ba dag gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la bsti stang du byed do //
translated: In those buddhafields he honors the lord buddhas with the worship and veneration appropriate to them.

original: bla mar byed do //
analyzed: bla mar byed do //
translated: He respects them.

original: ri mor byed do //
analyzed: ri mor byed do //
translated: and they are to be painted.🔽

original: mchod pa byed do //🔽sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag las /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: mchod pa byed do // sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag las / 'di lta ste /
translated: they make offerings to them.

original: theg pa chen po 'di nyid kyi chos nyan to //
analyzed: theg pa chen po 'di nyid kyi chos nyan to //
translated: From those lord buddhas they hear this very Great Vehicle.🔽They mount that Great Vehicle

original: de theg pa chen po de la zhon te; sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro zhing /🔽sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su dag par byed /
analyzed: de theg pa chen po de la zhon te; sangs rgyas kyi zhing nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro zhing / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yang yongs su dag par byed /
translated: and, traveling from buddhafield to buddhafield,

original: sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed la /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyang yongs su smin par byed la /
translated: they purify a buddhafield and bring beings to maturity.

original: de la sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi 'du shes kyang mi 'byung /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi 'du shes kyang mi 'byung /
translated: And they do not have the notion of a buddhafield,

original: sems can gyi 'du shes kyang mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sems can gyi 'du shes kyang mi 'byung ngo //
translated: nor do they have the notion of a being.

original: de gnyis su med pa'i sa la gnas te /
analyzed: de gnyis su med pa'i sa la gnas te /
translated: Abiding in the stage that is not dual,

original: lus ci lta bus sems can rnams kyi don byed nus @201b pa de lta bu'i lus bsam bzhin du yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: lus ci lta bus sems can rnams kyi don byed nus @201b pa de lta bu'i lus bsam bzhin du yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: they intentionally take on a body that is able to act for the welfare of beings.

original: de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes thob par gyur gyi bar du nam yang theg pa de dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi ye shes thob par gyur gyi bar du nam yang theg pa de dang bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Until they attain the knowledge of a knower of all aspects, they are never separated from that vehicle.

original: des rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob nas kyang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang /
analyzed: des rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob nas kyang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang / lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / dri za dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi'am ci dang /
translated: Having attained the knowledge of all aspects, they will also teach the Dharma to the śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans, and nonhumans.

original: lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang mi ma yin pa dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis bskor bar mi nus pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ro //
analyzed: lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang mi ma yin pa dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis bskor bar mi nus pa'i chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ro //
translated: Having attained the knowledge of all modes, he turns the wheel of the Dharma which cannot be turned by any ascetic, or brāhmaṇa, or god, or Māra, or Brahmā, or by any one else in the world, and which is endowed with the five gnoses and the thirty-two marks.

original: de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa na /🔽shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dag kyang de'i bsngags pa brjod de /
analyzed: de bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa na / shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dag kyang de'i bsngags pa brjod de /
translated: Having fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening,🔽the blessed buddhas dwelling in the world systems of the eastern direction, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, proclaim his praise, saying:

original: 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams ga ge mo zhes bya ba zhig na /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams ga ge mo zhes bya ba zhig na /
translated: ‘In such and such a world system,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di zhes bya ba zhig theg pa chen po la zhon nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di zhes bya ba zhig theg pa chen po la zhon nas rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob ste /
translated: “The bodhisattva mahāsattva named so-and-so, having mounted the Great Vehicle, has attained the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob nas kyang chos kyi 'khor lo bskor to //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob nas kyang chos kyi 'khor lo bskor to //
translated: Having attained the knowledge of all aspects, he has turned the wheel of the Dharma.”

original: zhes snyan pa sgrogs shing dbyangs brjod pa mdzad do //🔽de bzhin du lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i @202a *//
analyzed: zhes snyan pa sgrogs shing dbyangs brjod pa mdzad do // de bzhin du lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i @202a *//
translated: In this way they proclaim his praise and sing his praises.

original: klung gi bye ma snyed dag na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang de'i bsngags pa brjod de /
analyzed: klung gi bye ma snyed dag na bzhugs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang de'i bsngags pa brjod de /
translated: In the same way, the lord buddhas who are in the southern, western, and northern directions, in the four intermediate directions, and in the zenith and the nadir—in world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River—proclaim his praise, saying:

original: 'jig rten gyi khams ga ge mo zhes bya ba zhig na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di zhes bya ba zhig rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams ga ge mo zhes bya ba zhig na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di zhes bya ba zhig rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob ste /
translated: “In such-and-such a world system, the bodhisattva mahāsattva named so-and-so has attained the knowledge of all aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob nas kyang chos kyi 'khor lo bskor te //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob nas kyang chos kyi 'khor lo bskor te //
translated: and having attained the knowledge of all modes, he turns the wheel of the Dharma.

original: zhes snyan pa sgrogs shing dbyangs brjod pa mdzad do //
analyzed: zhes snyan pa sgrogs shing dbyangs brjod pa mdzad do //
translated: Thus he proclaims his fame and speaks his praise.

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: The Lord: So it is, Shariputra, so it is.

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la yang dag par gnas pa zhes bya'o //🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la yang dag par gnas pa zhes bya'o // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
translated: Thus, Shariputra, is the Bodhisattva, the great being, well-founded in the great vehicle.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi le'u zhes bya ste bcu gsum pa'o ////
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi le'u zhes bya ste bcu gsum pa'o ////
translated: This was the thirteenth chapter, “The Six Perfections,” in “The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa /
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines

original: bam po bcu pa /🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //🔽bcom ldan 'das /🔽go cha chen po bgos /
analyzed: bam po bcu pa / de nas bcom ldan 'das la tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to // bcom ldan 'das / go cha chen po bgos /
translated: Chapter Fourteen🔽Then the Lord said to the Venerable Subhuti:

original: go cha chen po bgos zhes bgyi na; bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: go cha chen po bgos zhes bgyi na; bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Subhuti, you have been chosen by the Tathagata to expound to the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, the perfection of wisdom.

original: ci tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po bgos /
analyzed: ci tsam gyis na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po bgos /
translated: “What is the great armor of the bodhisattva great beings?

original: zhes bgyi ba lags /
analyzed: zhes bgyi ba lags /
translated: That is what it is called.🔽🔽

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po'i go cha bgos pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po'i go cha bgos pa /
translated: “Su­bhūti, here great bodhisattva beings, who are clad in the great armor,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: are as follows:

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha bgos /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha bgos /
translated: They are clad in the armor of the transcendent perfection of generosity,

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / @202b bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha bgos /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / @202b bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i go cha bgos /
translated: similarly, they are clad in the armor of the transcendent perfection of ethical discipline, the transcendent perfection of tolerance, the transcendent perfection of perseverance, the transcendent perfection of meditative concentration, and the transcendent perfection of wisdom.

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa'i go cha bgos /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa'i go cha bgos /
translated: They are clad in the armor of the applications of mindfulness,

original: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam gyi go cha bgos /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / dbang po dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag dang / lam gyi go cha bgos /
translated: and they are clad in the armor of the correct exertions, the supports for miraculous ability, the faculties, the powers, the branches of enlightenment, and the path.

original: nang stong pa nyid kyi go cha bgos /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid kyi go cha bgos /
translated: He dons the armor of inner emptiness.

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi go cha bgos /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyi go cha bgos /
translated: He dons the armor of the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities.

original: stobs kyi go cha bgos /
analyzed: stobs kyi go cha bgos /
translated: He dons the armor of the powers.

original: mi 'jigs pa'i go cha bgos /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa'i go cha bgos /
translated: He dons the armor of fearlessness.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa'i go cha bgos /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa'i go cha bgos /
translated: He dons the armor of the correct understandings.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi go cha bgos /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi go cha bgos /
translated: He dons the armor of the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi go cha bgos /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi go cha bgos /
translated: He dons the armor of the knowledge of all aspects.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku'i go cha bgos nas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams snang bas khyab par byed cing g-yo bar yang byed de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku'i go cha bgos nas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams snang bas khyab par byed cing g-yo bar yang byed de /
translated: Having donned the armor of the buddha body, he pervades and shakes the world systems of the great trichiliocosm with his radiance.

original: sems can dmyal ba thams cad kyi gnas rnams su me rab tu zhi bar byas nas /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba thams cad kyi gnas rnams su me rab tu zhi bar byas nas /
translated: He pacifies the fires in all the realms of the hells.

original: sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal rnams rab tu zhi bar byas te /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal rnams rab tu zhi bar byas te /
translated: He pacifies the suffering of the beings in the hells.

original: sems can de dag la sdug bsngal rnams zhi bar rig par byed cing /
analyzed: sems can de dag la sdug bsngal rnams zhi bar rig par byed cing /
translated: He makes those beings aware that their suffering has been pacified.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de 'di skad ces de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de 'di skad ces de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: The bodhisattva will say, ‘Homage to the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One!’

original: zhes bya ba'i sgra brjod cing dbyangs sgrog go /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sgra brjod cing dbyangs sgrog go /
translated: And he will utter the sound of this and proclaim it.

original: de nas sems can dmyal ba pa de dag gis sangs rgyas kyi sgra de thos nas /
analyzed: de nas sems can dmyal ba pa de dag gis sangs rgyas kyi sgra de thos nas /
translated: Then, those beings in the hells, having heard that sound of the Buddha,

original: bde ba dang / yid bde ba thob ste /
analyzed: bde ba dang / yid bde ba thob ste /
translated: will attain happiness and mental ease.

original: bde ba dang / yid bde ba @203a *//
analyzed: bde ba dang / yid bde ba @203a *//
translated: By that very happiness and mental ease,

original: de nyid kyis sems can dmyal ba de dag nas byung nas /
analyzed: de nyid kyis sems can dmyal ba de dag nas byung nas /
translated: they will emerge from those hells.

original: gang dang gang na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams bzhugs te mthong zhing mnyes par byar yod pa dang / lha dang mir skye bar 'gyur ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams de dang der skye'o //
analyzed: gang dang gang na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams bzhugs te mthong zhing mnyes par byar yod pa dang / lha dang mir skye bar 'gyur ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams de dang der skye'o //
translated: They will be reborn in those worlds where the Blessed Buddhas are present, where they can see and please them, and where they will be reborn as gods or humans.

original: de bzhin du dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten nas sems can rnams byung nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten nas sems can rnams byung nas /
translated: In the same way, beings will emerge from the animal realms and the world of Yama,

original: gang dang gang na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams bzhugs pa de dang der skye'o //
analyzed: gang dang gang na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams bzhugs pa de dang der skye'o //
translated: Wherever the blessed buddhas are, there they are born.

original: de bzhin du shar dang / lho dang / nub dang / byang phyogs dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag snang bas khyab par byed cing /
analyzed: de bzhin du shar dang / lho dang / nub dang / byang phyogs dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag snang bas khyab par byed cing /
translated: In the same way, they pervade with light the worlds in the east, south, west, north, northeast, southeast, southwest, northwest, below, and above, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river.

original: rnam pa drug tu g-yo bar yang byed de /
analyzed: rnam pa drug tu g-yo bar yang byed de /
translated: They shake them in six ways:

original: sems can dmyal ba thams cad kyi gnas rnams su me rab tu zhi bar byas nas /🔽sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal rnams rab tu zhi bar byas te /
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba thams cad kyi gnas rnams su me rab tu zhi bar byas nas / sems can dmyal ba pa'i sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal rnams rab tu zhi bar byas te /
translated: they extinguish the fires in all the hells,🔽they extinguish the sufferings of the beings in the hells,

original: sems can de dag la sdug bsngal rnams zhi bar rig par byed cing /
analyzed: sems can de dag la sdug bsngal rnams zhi bar rig par byed cing /
translated: and they make the beings there aware of the cessation of their sufferings.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de 'di skad ces /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de 'di skad ces /
translated: The bodhisattvas say to them:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One!”

original: zhes bya ba'i sgra brjod cing dbyangs sgrog go /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sgra brjod cing dbyangs sgrog go /
translated: Thus they uttered these words and proclaimed this verse.

original: de nas sems can dmyal ba pa de dag gis sangs rgyas kyi sgra de thos nas bde ba dang / yid bde ba thob ste /
analyzed: de nas sems can dmyal ba pa de dag gis sangs rgyas kyi sgra de thos nas bde ba dang / yid bde ba thob ste /
translated: Then, having heard the word Buddha, those beings in the hells attained happiness and mental ease.

original: bde ba dang / yid bde ba de nyid kyis sems can dmyal ba de @203b dag nas byung nas /
analyzed: bde ba dang / yid bde ba de nyid kyis sems can dmyal ba de @203b dag nas byung nas /
translated: By that very happiness and mental ease, they emerged from the hells.

original: gang dang gang na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams bzhugs te /
analyzed: gang dang gang na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams bzhugs te /
translated: Wherever the Blessed Buddhas were present,

original: mthong zhing / bsnyen bkur byar yod pa dang / lha dang mir skye bar 'gyur ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams de dang der skye'o //
analyzed: mthong zhing / bsnyen bkur byar yod pa dang / lha dang mir skye bar 'gyur ba'i 'jig rten gyi khams de dang der skye'o //
translated: they were reborn in those worlds where they could see and serve them, and where they would be reborn as gods or humans.

original: mir skyes nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la mnyes par byed do //
analyzed: mir skyes nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag la mnyes par byed do //
translated: Having been reborn as humans, they pleased those Blessed Buddhas.

original: de bzhin du dud 'gro'i skye gnas rnams dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten rnams nas sems can de dag shi 'phos te /
analyzed: de bzhin du dud 'gro'i skye gnas rnams dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten rnams nas sems can de dag shi 'phos te /
translated: In the same way, those beings in the animal realms and the world of Yama died and transmigrated.

original: gang dang gang na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams bzhugs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams de dang der skye'o //
analyzed: gang dang gang na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams bzhugs pa'i 'jig rten gyi khams de dang der skye'o //
translated: He is reborn in those worlds where the Bhagavat Buddhas are.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po bgos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po bgos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Subhuti, it is in this way that the Bodhisattva, the great being, is said to be armed with the great armor.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /🔽dper na / sgyu ma mkhan nam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste / dper na / sgyu ma mkhan nam /
translated: Subhuti, it is like this:

original: sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma mkhas pa zhig gis lam po che'i bzhi mdor skye bo phal po che'i mdun du sems can dmyal ba dag dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten mngon par sprul la /
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma mkhas pa zhig gis lam po che'i bzhi mdor skye bo phal po che'i mdun du sems can dmyal ba dag dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten mngon par sprul la /
translated: For example, a magician or a magician's apprentice would manifest in front of a large crowd of people at the crossroads of four highways the hells, the animal realm, and the world of Yama,

original: des mngon par sprul nas /
analyzed: des mngon par sprul nas /
translated: and after manifesting them,

original: sems can de dag la sangs rgyas kyi sgra dang / chos kyi sgra dang / dge 'dun gyi sgra bsgrags te /
analyzed: sems can de dag la sangs rgyas kyi sgra dang / chos kyi sgra dang / dge 'dun gyi sgra bsgrags te /
translated: he would proclaim to those beings the words of the Buddha, the words of the Dharma, and the words of the Sangha.

original: de nas sprul pa de dag sangs rgyas kyi sgra dang / chos kyi sgra dang / dge 'dun gyi sgra des sems can dmyal ba de dag dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten nas byung bar gyur na /
analyzed: de nas sprul pa de dag sangs rgyas kyi sgra dang / chos kyi sgra dang / dge 'dun gyi sgra des sems can dmyal ba de dag dang / dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten nas byung bar gyur na /
translated: Then, those emanations, with the sound of the Buddha, the sound of the Dharma, and the sound of the Saṅgha, would cause those sentient beings to emerge from the hells, from the animal realms, and from the world of Yama.

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /🔽sgyu ma mkhan nam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems / sgyu ma mkhan nam /
translated: Subhūti, what do you think?

original: sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma des sems can 'ga' yang sems can dmyal ba rnams dang / dud 'gro'i @204a *//
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma des sems can 'ga' yang sems can dmyal ba rnams dang / dud 'gro'i @204a *//
translated: Would that magician or magician’s apprentice have caused any sentient beings to emerge from the hells, from the animal realms,

original: skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten dag nas phyung ba yod snyam mam /
analyzed: skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten dag nas phyung ba yod snyam mam /
translated: and from the world of Yama?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Blessed One,

original: de ni ma mchis lags so //
analyzed: de ni ma mchis lags so //
translated: that would not be the case.”🔽The Blessed One said,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: “Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med dpag tu med pa rnams su sems can rnams ngan 'gro gsum po dag las yongs su bkrol yang sems can 'ga' yang yongs su bkrol bar gyur pa med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'jig rten gyi khams grangs med dpag tu med pa rnams su sems can rnams ngan 'gro gsum po dag las yongs su bkrol yang sems can 'ga' yang yongs su bkrol bar gyur pa med do //
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, although bodhisattva great beings have freed beings from the three bad migrations in countless, immeasurable world systems, they have not freed any beings at all.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: rab 'byor / sgyu ma'i chos nyid nye bar bzung na chos rnams kyi chos nyid 'di yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / sgyu ma'i chos nyid nye bar bzung na chos rnams kyi chos nyid 'di yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Subhūti, it is because this is the true nature of dharmas, when you take the true nature of an illusory phenomenon as your point of reference.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po bgos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po bgos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, that is the kind of bodhisattva great beings who are said to be wearing the great armor.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings standing in the perfection of generosity

original: go cha chen po bgos nas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams bee d'urya'i rang bzhin du mngon par sprul te; stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams bee d'urya'i rang bzhin du mngon par sprul nas /
analyzed: go cha chen po bgos nas stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams bee d'urya'i rang bzhin du mngon par sprul te; stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams bee d'urya'i rang bzhin du mngon par sprul nas /
translated: Having emanated a trichiliocosm as the nature of beryl,

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i bkod pa mngon par sprul pa byed do //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i bkod pa mngon par sprul pa byed do //
translated: he emanates the array of a universal monarch.

original: des 'khor los sgyur ba'i bkod pa mngon par sprul nas /
analyzed: des 'khor los sgyur ba'i bkod pa mngon par sprul nas /
translated: Having emanated the array of a universal monarch,

original: zas 'dod pa rnams la zas sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: zas 'dod pa rnams la zas sbyin par byed do //
translated: he gives food to those who desire food.🔽Similarly, he gives drink, clothing, vehicles,🔽incense, flower garlands, flowers, perfume, ointments, powders,

original: de bzhin du btung ba dang / gos dang / bzhon pa dang / spos dang / me tog phreng dang / me tog dang / bdug pa @204b dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / yo byad dang / gnas dang / mal cha dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du btung ba dang / gos dang / bzhon pa dang / spos dang / me tog phreng dang / me tog dang / bdug pa @204b dang / byug pa dang / phye ma dang / yo byad dang / gnas dang / mal cha dang /
translated: requisites, dwellings, bedding,

original: bgo ba dang / 'tsho ba'i yo byad dang / rtsi sman dang / gser dang / dngul dang / nor bu dang / rin po che dang / byu ru dang / dung dang / man shal dang / mu tig dang / rgyan dag dang / yo byad gang yang rung ba dag sbyin par byed do //🔽des zas 'dod pa rnams la zas byin zhing yo byad gang yang rung ba'i bar dag byin nas sems can de dag la /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: bgo ba dang / 'tsho ba'i yo byad dang / rtsi sman dang / gser dang / dngul dang / nor bu dang / rin po che dang / byu ru dang / dung dang / man shal dang / mu tig dang / rgyan dag dang / yo byad gang yang rung ba dag sbyin par byed do // des zas 'dod pa rnams la zas byin zhing yo byad gang yang rung ba'i bar dag byin nas sems can de dag la / 'di lta ste /
translated: and whatever other necessities they may need, such as food, clothing, bedding, medicine, gold, silver, jewels, pearls, beryl, conches, crystal, coral, or whatever else they may need.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ldan pa'i chos bstan pa 'di nyid kyi chos ston to //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ldan pa'i chos bstan pa 'di nyid kyi chos ston to //
translated: “Having given them food, and whatever other necessities they may need, he teaches them the Dharma, teaching this very perfection of wisdom and skill in means.

original: sems can de dag gis kyang chos bstan pa de thos nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang nam yang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can de dag gis kyang chos bstan pa de thos nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang nam yang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Those beings, having heard that Dharma teaching, will not be separated from the six perfections until they have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: “Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na / sgyu ma mkhan nam /
analyzed: dper na / sgyu ma mkhan nam /
translated: For example, it is like a magician🔽or a painted image.

original: sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma mkhas pa zhig gis lam po che'i bzhi mdor skye bo phal po che'i mdun du skye bo'i tshogs chen po zhig mngon par sprul te /
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma mkhas pa zhig gis lam po che'i bzhi mdor skye bo phal po che'i mdun du skye bo'i tshogs chen po zhig mngon par sprul te /
translated: For example, a magician or a magician’s apprentice would conjure up a great crowd of people in the presence of a large group of people at the junction of two main roads,

original: zas 'dod pa rnams la zas byin zhing /
analyzed: zas 'dod pa rnams la zas byin zhing /
translated: and give food to those who wanted food,

original: mi'i yo byad gang yang rung ba'i bar du byin na /
analyzed: mi'i yo byad gang yang rung ba'i bar du byin na /
translated: and give whatever human necessities they needed.

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /🔽sgyu ma mkhan nam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems / sgyu ma mkhan nam /
translated: Subhūti, what do you think about this?

original: sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma des sems can gang la'ang ci'ang byin pa yod snyam mam /
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma des sems can gang la'ang ci'ang byin pa yod snyam mam /
translated: Would that magician or magician’s apprentice have given anything to any sentient being?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: He replied, “Blessed One,

original: de ni ma mchis lags so //
analyzed: de ni ma mchis lags so //

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'khor los sgyur ba'i bkod pa mngon @205a *// par sprul te / zas 'dod pa rnams la zas byin zhing /
translated: “Subhūti, in the same way, a bodhisattva great being conjures up the array of a wheel-turning emperor,🔽and gives food to those who want food,

analyzed: mi'i yo byad gang yang rung ba'i bar du byin yang /

original: sems can gang la'ang ci'ang byin pa med do /
analyzed: sems can gang la'ang ci'ang byin pa med do /

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽sgyu ma'i chos nyid nye bar bzung na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / sgyu ma'i chos nyid nye bar bzung na /

analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid 'di yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because, taking the true nature of illusion as the basis, this is the true nature of dharmas.

analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po bgos pa zhes bya'o //

analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /

analyzed: bsam bzhin du skye ba yongs su 'dzin cing /
translated: take up a birth as they wish,

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rigs su skye ste /
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rigs su skye ste /

analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i dbang phyug de la gnas nas /

analyzed: sems can rnams dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la 'god par byed /

original: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi la 'god par byed /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi dang / gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa bzhi la 'god par byed /
translated: and establish them in the four concentrations, four immeasurables, and four formless absorptions.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi bar dag la 'god par byed /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi bar dag la 'god par byed /

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag la 'god par byed cing /

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /🔽dper na / sgyu ma mkhan nam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste / dper na / sgyu ma mkhan nam /
translated: “Subhūti, it is like this:🔽for example, a skilled magician or magician’s apprentice, having conjured up a large crowd of people in the presence of a large crowd of people at the junction of two main roads,

analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma mkhas pa zhig gis lam po che'i bzhi @205b mdor skye bo phal po che'i mdun du skye bo'i tshogs chen po zhig mngon par sprul nas dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la bkod cing /

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag la bkod na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag la bkod na /
translated: up to and having established them in the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /

analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan nam /

analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma des sems can 'ga' yang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la bkod pa'am /

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag la bkod pa yod snyam mam /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag la bkod pa yod snyam mam /

analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni ma mchis lags so //
translated: “No, Blessed One, he has not.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can grangs med tshad med pa dag dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la bkod cing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can grangs med tshad med pa dag dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la bkod cing /
translated: “Subhūti, in the same way, although bodhisattva great beings establish countless, limitless sentient beings in the ten wholesome courses of action,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag la bkod kyang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag la bkod kyang /
translated: and in the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,

analyzed: sems can 'ga' yang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam la bkod pa'am /
translated: they do not establish any sentient beings in the ten wholesome courses of action,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag la bkod pa med do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag la bkod pa med do //
translated: or in the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: rab 'byor / sgyu ma'i chos nyid nye bar bzung nas chos rnams kyi chos nyid 'di yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / sgyu ma'i chos nyid nye bar bzung nas chos rnams kyi chos nyid 'di yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Subhūti, it is because this is the true nature of dharmas, taking the true nature of illusory dharmas as the basis.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po bgos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po bgos pa zhes bya'o //

analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te / sems can thams cad bzod pa'i @206a *//
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, bodhisattva mahāsattvas, standing in the perfection of patience,

analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor zhing 'god par byed do //

analyzed: rab 'byor / ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /

analyzed: sems can rnams bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor zhing 'god ce na /

original: gal te sems can thams cad kyis bdag la dbyig pa dang / bong ba dang / khu tshur dang / lag cha dang / mtshon gyis 'debs kyang de la bdag gis 'khrug pa'i sems 'ga' yang bskyed par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gal te sems can thams cad kyis bdag la dbyig pa dang / bong ba dang / khu tshur dang / lag cha dang / mtshon gyis 'debs kyang de la bdag gis 'khrug pa'i sems 'ga' yang bskyed par mi bya'o //
translated: Even if all sentient beings were to strike me with clods, sticks, and swords, I would not become angry even for a moment, let alone repay abuse with abuse or insult with insult.

original: snyam zhing / sems can thams cad kyang bzod pa de lta bu la 'god do //
analyzed: snyam zhing / sems can thams cad kyang bzod pa de lta bu la 'god do //
translated: I will establish all sentient beings in that kind of patience.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /🔽dper na / sgyu ma mkhan nam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste / dper na / sgyu ma mkhan nam /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems / sgyu ma mkhan nam /

analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma des sems can 'ga' yang bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la bkod pa yod snyam mam /

analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /

analyzed: rab 'byor / sgyu ma'i chos nyid nye bar bzung na /

analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /

analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba med par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong nge //
