original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa yin te /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings standing in the perfection of concentration are like that.

original: des de bzhin du sems can thams cad kyang bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing 'dzud de 'god par byed do //
analyzed: des de bzhin du sems can thams cad kyang bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing 'dzud de 'god par byed do //
translated: In the same way, they cause all sentient beings to take up the perfection of concentration, and they introduce them to it and establish them in it.

original: yang dag par 'dzin du bcug pa de dag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du nam yang bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin du bcug pa de dag kyang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du nam yang bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And those whom they have caused to take it up will never be separated from the perfection of concentration until they have attained highest genuine full awakening.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /🔽dper na / sgyu ma mkhan nam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste / dper na / sgyu ma mkhan nam /
translated: “Subhūti, it is like this:

original: sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma mkhas pa zhig gis lam po che'i bzhi mdor skye bo phal po che'i mdun du skye bo'i tshogs chen po zhig mngon par sprul nas bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par 'dzin du bcug cing btsud de bkod na🔽/ rab 'byor /
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma mkhas pa zhig gis lam po che'i bzhi mdor skye bo phal po che'i mdun du skye bo'i tshogs chen po zhig mngon par sprul nas bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par 'dzin du bcug cing btsud de bkod na / rab 'byor /
translated: for example, a magician or magician’s apprentice would, at a main road junction, in front of a great crowd of people, conjure up a great crowd of people and cause them to take up the perfection of concentration, introduce them to it, and establish them in it.

original: 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: What do you think, Subhūti?

original: sgyu ma mkhan nam /
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan nam /
translated: Would that magician or magician’s apprentice have caused even one being to take up the perfection of concentration, introduced them to it, and established them in it?”

original: sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma @208a *//
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma @208a *//
translated: “What do you think, Subhūti,

original: des sems can 'ga' yang bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par 'dzin du bcug cing btsud de bkod pa yod snyam mam /
analyzed: des sems can 'ga' yang bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par 'dzin du bcug cing btsud de bkod pa yod snyam mam /
translated: does the illusionist or the apprentice of the illusionist who has induced and established beings in the perfection of concentration have any beings established in the perfection of concentration?”

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: de ni ma mchis lags so //
analyzed: de ni ma mchis lags so //
translated: there are none.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can thams cad bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par 'dzin du bcug cing btsud de bkod kyang sems can 'ga' yang bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bkod pa med do
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can thams cad bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par 'dzin du bcug cing btsud de bkod kyang sems can 'ga' yang bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bkod pa med do
translated: “Subhūti, in the same way, although bodhisattva great beings induce and establish all beings in the perfection of concentration, they do not establish any beings in the perfection of concentration.

original: // de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽rab 'byor / sgyu ma'i chos nyid nye bar bzung na /
analyzed: // de ci'i phyir zhe na / rab 'byor / sgyu ma'i chos nyid nye bar bzung na /
translated: And why?

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid 'di yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid 'di yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Subhūti, it is because, when you take the reality of an illusion as the standard, this is the reality of phenomena.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po bgos ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po bgos ba zhes bya'o //
translated: In this way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva is said to be wearing the great armor.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva, abiding in the perfection of wisdom,

original: sems can thams cad kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing 'dzud de 'god par byed do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing 'dzud de 'god par byed do //
translated: causes all sentient beings to take up the perfection of wisdom, and establishes them in it.

original: rab 'byor / ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas te /
translated: Subhūti, how does the bodhisattva mahāsattva, abiding in the perfection of wisdom,

original: sems can thams cad shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing 'dzud de 'god ce na /
analyzed: sems can thams cad shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing 'dzud de 'god ce na /
translated: cause all sentient beings to take up the perfection of wisdom, and establish them in it?

original: @208b rab 'byor /
analyzed: @208b rab 'byor /
translated: Subhūti,

original: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
analyzed: 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas /
translated: here the bodhisattva mahāsattva, practicing the perfection of wisdom,

original: chos gang la'ang skye ba'am /
analyzed: chos gang la'ang skye ba'am /
translated: in no dharma whatsoever

original: 'gag pa'am / kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
analyzed: 'gag pa'am / kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
translated: nor does it cease, nor is it defiled,🔽

original: rnam par byang ba'am /🔽tshu rol lam /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'am / tshu rol lam /
translated: nor does he apprehend a cessation, nor does he apprehend a defilement,🔽nor does he apprehend a purification,🔽nor does he apprehend a near shore,

original: pha rol mi dmigs so //
analyzed: pha rol mi dmigs so //
translated: nor does he apprehend a far shore.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa yin te /
translated: “Subhūti, that is how bodhisattva great beings stand in the perfection of wisdom.

original: des de bzhin du sems can thams cad kyang /
analyzed: des de bzhin du sems can thams cad kyang /
translated: In that way they cause all beings

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing 'dzud de 'god do //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing 'dzud de 'god do //
translated: to take up the perfection of wisdom, introduce them to it, and establish them in it.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /🔽dper na / sgyu ma mkhan nam /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste / dper na / sgyu ma mkhan nam /
translated: “Subhūti, it is like this:

original: sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma mkhas pa zhig gis lam po che'i bzhi mdor skye bo phal po che'i mdun du skye bo'i tshogs chen po zhig mngon par sprul nas /
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma mkhas pa zhig gis lam po che'i bzhi mdor skye bo phal po che'i mdun du skye bo'i tshogs chen po zhig mngon par sprul nas /
translated: for example, a skilled magician or magician’s apprentice might conjure up a large crowd of people at a crossroads in a big town in front of a large crowd of people

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par 'dzin du bcug cing btsud de bkod na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par 'dzin du bcug cing btsud de bkod na /
translated: and cause them to take up the perfection of wisdom, introduce them to it, and establish them in it.

original: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: What do you think about this, Subhūti?

original: sgyu ma mkhan nam /
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan nam /
translated: Would that magician or magician’s apprentice

original: sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma des sems can 'ga' yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bkod pa yod snyam mam /
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma des sems can 'ga' yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bkod pa yod snyam mam /
translated: Subhūti, do you think that the magician's apprentice has established any sentient beings in the perfection of wisdom?

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /🔽bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Subhūti replied,🔽No, Blessed One.

original: de ni ma mchis lags so //
analyzed: de ni ma mchis lags so //
translated: Blessed One, he has not.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can thams cad shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bkod kyang /🔽sems can 'ga' yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa @209a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can thams cad shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la bkod kyang / sems can 'ga' yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa @209a *//
translated: Subhūti, in the same way, although bodhisattva great beings establish all sentient beings in the perfection of wisdom,

original: la bkod pa med do //
analyzed: la bkod pa med do //
translated: they do not establish any sentient beings in the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽rab 'byor / sgyu ma'i chos nyid nye bar bzung na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / rab 'byor / sgyu ma'i chos nyid nye bar bzung na /
translated: Why is that?

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid 'di yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid 'di yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Subhūti, it is because, taking the reality of illusions as an analogy, this is the reality of phenomena.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po bgos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po bgos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, in that way, bodhisattva great beings are said to don the great armor.🔽Subhūti then asked, Blessed One, what is the armor of bodhisattva great beings?

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po bgos pa ni shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu song zhing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po bgos pa ni shar phyogs kyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu song zhing /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who has donned the great armor goes to the world systems in the eastern direction, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river,

original: de ji ltar bdag sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa bzhin du /
analyzed: de ji ltar bdag sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa bzhin du /
translated: and just as he himself abides in the perfection of generosity,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams de dag na sems can gang dag 'khod pa'i sems can dag kyang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing 'dzud de 'god par byed do //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams de dag na sems can gang dag 'khod pa'i sems can dag kyang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing 'dzud de 'god par byed do //
translated: he causes the sentient beings who are situated in those world systems to take up the perfection of generosity, to enter into it, and to be established in it.

original: de bzhin du ji ltar bdag tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa bzhin du sems can de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar dag yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing 'dzud de 'god par byed la /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du ji ltar bdag tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa bzhin du sems can de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar dag yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing 'dzud de 'god par byed la / 'di lta ste /
translated: In the same way, just as I abide in the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom, I cause those sentient beings to take up, enter into, and become established in the perfection of wisdom.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ldan pa 'di nyid kyi chos kyang ston to //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ldan pa 'di nyid kyi chos kyang ston to //
translated: I teach the Dharma endowed with the six perfections.

original: sems can de dag kyang chos de thos nas /
analyzed: sems can de dag kyang chos de thos nas /
translated: Those sentient beings, having heard that Dharma,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs @209b par sangs rgyas kyi bar du nam yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs @209b par sangs rgyas kyi bar du nam yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: will never be separated from the six perfections until they fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood.

original: de bzhin du lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs kyi phyogs re rer yang 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu song zhing /
analyzed: de bzhin du lho dang / nub dang / byang dang / byang shar dang / shar lho dang / lho nub dang / nub byang dang / 'og dang / steng gi phyogs kyi phyogs re rer yang 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed dag tu song zhing /
translated: In the same way, he goes to as many world systems as there are sand particles in the Gaṅgā River in the south, west, north, northeast, southeast, southwest, northwest, below, and above.

original: de ji ltar bdag sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams de dag na sems can gang dag 'khod pa'i sems can de dag kyang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing 'dzud de 'god
analyzed: de ji ltar bdag sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa bzhin du 'jig rten gyi khams de dag na sems can gang dag 'khod pa'i sems can de dag kyang sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing 'dzud de 'god
translated: Just as he himself abides in the perfection of generosity, he also causes the sentient beings who are present in those world systems to take up the perfection of generosity, to enter into it, and to be established in it.

original: do // de bzhin du ji ltar bdag tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa bzhin du sems can de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar dag yang dag bar 'dzin du 'jug cing 'dzud de 'god la /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: do // de bzhin du ji ltar bdag tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pa bzhin du sems can de dag kyang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar dag yang dag bar 'dzin du 'jug cing 'dzud de 'god la / 'di lta ste /
translated: In the same way, just as I stand in the perfection of morality, perfection of patience, perfection of perseverance, perfection of concentration, and perfection of wisdom, so I will lead those beings to take up the perfection of wisdom, and I will establish them in it.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ldan pa 'di nyid kyi chos kyang ston to //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang ldan pa 'di nyid kyi chos kyang ston to //
translated: And I will teach them the Dharma endowed with the six perfections, namely:

original: sems can de dag kyang chos de thos nas /
analyzed: sems can de dag kyang chos de thos nas /
translated: And those beings, having heard that Dharma,

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du nam yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas kyi bar du nam yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang 'bral bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: will not be separated from the six perfections until they have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: “Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na / sgyu ma mkhan nam /🔽sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma mkhas pa zhig gis lam po che'i bzhi mdor skye bo phal po che'i @210a *//
analyzed: dper na / sgyu ma mkhan nam / sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma mkhas pa zhig gis lam po che'i bzhi mdor skye bo phal po che'i @210a *//
translated: For example,

original: mdun du skye bo'i tshogs chen po zhig mngon par sprul nas /
analyzed: mdun du skye bo'i tshogs chen po zhig mngon par sprul nas /
translated: a magician or a magician’s skilled apprentice might conjure up a large crowd of people in the middle of a busy intersection

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug yang dag par 'dzin du bcug cing btsud de bkod na /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug yang dag par 'dzin du bcug cing btsud de bkod na /
translated: and get them to take up, enter into, and follow the six perfections.

original: rab 'byor 'di ji snyam du sems /🔽sgyu ma mkhan nam /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ji snyam du sems / sgyu ma mkhan nam /
translated: What do you think, Subhūti,

original: sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma des sems can 'ga' yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug yang dag par 'dzin du bcug cing btsud de bkod pa yod snyam mam /
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma des sems can 'ga' yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug yang dag par 'dzin du bcug cing btsud de bkod pa yod snyam mam /
translated: would that magician or magician’s skilled apprentice have caused any sentient beings to take up, enter into, and follow the six perfections?”

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: de ni ma mchis lags so //
analyzed: de ni ma mchis lags so //
translated: no, they would not.”🔽The Blessed One said,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: “Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shar phyogs dang / phyogs bcu kun gyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed po de dag gi sems can de dag thams cad pha rol tu phyin pa drug la bkod kyang sems can 'ga' yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug la bkod pa med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shar phyogs dang / phyogs bcu kun gyi 'jig rten gyi khams gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed po de dag gi sems can de dag thams cad pha rol tu phyin pa drug la bkod kyang sems can 'ga' yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug la bkod pa med do //
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, even though a bodhisattva great being establishes all those beings in the ten directions, in world systems as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river, in the six perfections, he does not establish even one being in the six perfections.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽rab 'byor / sgyu ma'i chos nyid nye bar bzung na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / rab 'byor / sgyu ma'i chos nyid nye bar bzung na /
translated: And why?

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid 'di yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid 'di yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Subhūti, it is because of the dharmatā of dharmas, which is like an illusory phenomenon.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po bgos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po bgos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Subhūti, it is because of that that a bodhisattva great being is said to be wearing the great armor.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po bgos pa ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha chen po bgos pa ni /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, a bodhisattva great being wearing the great armor

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems kyis gnas shing /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems kyis gnas shing /
translated: dwells with a mind endowed with the knowledge of all aspects.

original: sems bskyed pa gzhan @210b gyi skabs mi 'byed de /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa gzhan @210b gyi skabs mi 'byed de /
translated: He does not make a distinction between other arousings of mind.

original: bdag gis sems can 'di snyed cig ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis sems can 'di snyed cig ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la dgod par bya'o //
translated: “I must establish this many beings in the perfection of generosity.

original: 'di snyed cig ni dgod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di snyed cig ni dgod par mi bya'o //
translated: I must not establish this many beings in the perfection of generosity.

original: sems can 'di snyed cig ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can 'di snyed cig ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la dgod par bya'o //
translated: I must establish this many beings in the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of concentration, and the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'di snyed cig ni dgod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di snyed cig ni dgod par mi bya'o //
translated: I must not establish this many beings in the perfection of wisdom.

original: sems can 'di snyed cig ni dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can 'di snyed cig ni dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams la dgod par bya'o //
translated: I must establish this many beings in the applications of mindfulness.

original: 'di snyed cig ni dgod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di snyed cig ni dgod par mi bya'o //
translated: I must not establish this many beings in the applications of mindfulness.

original: sems can 'di snyed cig ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag la dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can 'di snyed cig ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar dag la dgod par bya'o //
translated: I must establish this many beings in the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: 'di snyed cig ni dgod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di snyed cig ni dgod par mi bya'o //
translated: I will not establish this many in awakening.

original: sems can 'di snyed cig ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can 'di snyed cig ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la dgod par bya'o //
translated: I will establish this many sentient beings in the result of stream enterer.

original: 'di snyed cig ni dgod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di snyed cig ni dgod par mi bya'o //
translated: I will not establish this many.

original: sems can 'di snyed cig ni lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid la dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can 'di snyed cig ni lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid la dgod par bya'o //
translated: I will establish this many sentient beings in the result of once-returner, in the result of non-returner, and in the state of a worthy one.

original: 'di snyed cig ni dgod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di snyed cig ni dgod par mi bya'o //
translated: I will not establish this many.

original: sems can 'di snyed cig ni rang byang chub la dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can 'di snyed cig ni rang byang chub la dgod par bya'o //
translated: I will establish this many sentient beings in individual enlightenment.

original: 'di snyed cig ni dgod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di snyed cig ni dgod par mi bya'o //
translated: I will not establish this many.

original: sems can 'di snyed cig ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can 'di snyed cig ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la dgod par bya'o //
translated: I will establish this many sentient beings in the knowledge of all aspects.

original: 'di snyed cig ni dgod par mi bya'o //🔽snyam du mi sems kyi /🔽gzhan du na de 'di snyam @211a *//
analyzed: 'di snyed cig ni dgod par mi bya'o // snyam du mi sems kyi / gzhan du na de 'di snyam @211a *//
translated: I will not establish this many.🔽’🔽But rather,

original: du sems te /
analyzed: du sems te /
translated: they think like this:

original: bdag gis sems can tshad med grangs med pa dag pha rol tu phyin pa drug la dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis sems can tshad med grangs med pa dag pha rol tu phyin pa drug la dgod par bya'o //
translated: ‘I will establish immeasurable, innumerable sentient beings in the six perfections.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun la dgod par bya'o //
translated: I will establish them in the thirty-seven aspects of enlightenment.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad la dgod par bya'o //
translated: I will establish them in the ten powers of the tathāgatas, the four assurances, the four kinds of exact knowledge, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la dgod par bya'o //
translated: I will establish them in the result of stream enterer.

original: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub la dgod par bya'o //🔽bdag gis sems can tshad med grangs med pa dag rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar dag la dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: lan gcig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu dang / dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub la dgod par bya'o // bdag gis sems can tshad med grangs med pa dag rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar dag la dgod par bya'o //
translated: I will establish them in the result of once-returner, in the result of non-returner, in the state of a worthy one, and in a pratyekabuddha’s awakening.

original: snyam du sems so //
analyzed: snyam du sems so //
translated: I will establish countless, immeasurable sentient beings in the ten wholesome actions up to in the knowledge of all aspects.’

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: “Subhūti, it is like this:🔽for example, a magician

original: dper na / sgyu ma mkhan nam /
analyzed: dper na / sgyu ma mkhan nam /
translated: or his apprentice

original: sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma mkhas pa zhig gis lam po che'i bzhi mdor skye bo phal po che'i mdun du skye bo'i tshogs chen po zhig mngon par sprul nas /
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma mkhas pa zhig gis lam po che'i bzhi mdor skye bo phal po che'i mdun du skye bo'i tshogs chen po zhig mngon par sprul nas /
translated: “To illustrate further, Subhūti, a skilled magician or magician’s apprentice might manifest a great crowd of people in front of a large group of people at a crossroads,

original: 'di snyam du bdag gis sems can tshad med grangs med pa 'di dag pha rol tu phyin pa drug la dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di snyam du bdag gis sems can tshad med grangs med pa 'di dag pha rol tu phyin pa drug la dgod par bya'o //
translated: and think, ‘I will establish these countless, limitless sentient beings in the six perfections,

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi la dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi la dgod par bya'o //
translated: I will establish them in the four applications of mindfulness,

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar la dgod par bya'o //
translated: I will establish them in the eightfold noble path, up to and I will establish them in the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha.

original: rgyun du zhugs @211b pa'i 'bras bu la dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs @211b pa'i 'bras bu la dgod par bya'o //
translated: I will establish them in the result of stream enterer,

original: dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub kyi bar la dgod par bya'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid dang / rang byang chub kyi bar la dgod par bya'o //
translated: I will establish them in the state of a worthy one, up to and in a pratyekabuddha’s awakening.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la dgod par bya'o //🔽snyam du sems bskyed na; rab 'byor /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la dgod par bya'o // snyam du sems bskyed na; rab 'byor /
translated: I will establish them in the knowledge of all aspects.’

original: 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: Subhūti, what do you think?

original: sgyu ma mkhan nam /
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan nam /
translated: Is that magician or magician’s apprentice deceiving some people?”

original: sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma des sems can 'ga' yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug la bkod pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la bkod pa yod snyam mam /
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan gyi slob ma des sems can 'ga' yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug la bkod pa dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bar la bkod pa yod snyam mam /
translated: “Subhūti, do you think that the magician’s apprentice has established any beings in the six perfections, up to and including the knowledge of all aspects?”

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: de ni ma mchis lags so //
analyzed: de ni ma mchis lags so //
translated: he has not.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can tshad med grangs med pa dag pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i bar la dgod par sems bskyed kyang sems can 'ga'i don gyi phyir yang sems bskyed pa med do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos sems can tshad med grangs med pa dag pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang / rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i bar la dgod par sems bskyed kyang sems can 'ga'i don gyi phyir yang sems bskyed pa med do //
translated: “Subhūti, in the same way, although bodhisattva great beings have given rise to the thought to establish countless, innumerable beings in the six perfections, up to and including the knowledge of all aspects endowed with the highest aspects, they have not given rise to the thought for the sake of even a single being.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: rab 'byor / sgyu ma'i chos nyid nye bar bzung na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / sgyu ma'i chos nyid nye bar bzung na /
translated: Subhūti, it is because, in terms of the real nature of illusory phenomena,

original: chos rnams kyi chos nyid 'di yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi chos nyid 'di yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: this is the real nature of phenomena.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni go cha chen po bgos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni go cha chen po bgos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Subhuti: Thus, O Lord, is the great armor of the Bodhisattva, the great being, to be known.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhuti: As I understand the meaning of the Lord's teaching,🔽the Bodhisattva, the great being, should be known as one who has set out in the armor if he has set out in the armor of emptiness, the signless, the wishless, of non­ production, of non­ stopping, of non­ defilement, of non­purification, of the absence of any dharma which could be shown, of the absence of any dharma which could be demonstrated.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: The Lord: So it is, Subhuti, so it is.

original: bdag gis bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs ba'i don 'tshal ba ltar na /
analyzed: bdag gis bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs ba'i don 'tshal ba ltar na /
translated: Subhuti: As I understand the meaning of the Lord's teaching,

original: chos rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi slad du sgyu ma'i chos nyid nye bar bzung na /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid kyi slad du sgyu ma'i chos nyid nye bar bzung na /
translated: the Bodhisattva, the great being, should be known as one who has set out in the great armor if he has set out in the armor of the emptiness of the conditioned and the unconditioned.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' @212a *//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' @212a *//
translated: The Lord: So it is, Subhuti, so it is.🔽Subhuti: As I understand the meaning of the Lord's teaching,

original: chen po de ni go cha ma mchis pa'i go cha 'tshal bar rig par bgyi ba lags pa snyam bgyid do //🔽de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: chen po de ni go cha ma mchis pa'i go cha 'tshal bar rig par bgyi ba lags pa snyam bgyid do // de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: the Bodhisattva, the great being, should be known as one who has set out in the great armor if he has set out in the armor of the emptiness of the past, the future, and the present.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: The Lord: So it is, Subhuti, so it is.🔽Subhuti: As I understand the meaning of the Lord's teaching,🔽the Bodhisattva, the great being, should be known as one who has set out in the great armor if he has set out in the armor of the emptiness of the internal, the external, and the both.

original: 'di ltar gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong /
translated: The Lord: So it is, Subhuti, so it is.🔽Subhuti: As I understand the meaning of the Lord's teaching,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pas stong /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa ni rnam par shes pas stong /
translated: the Bodhisattva, the great being, should be known as one who has set out in the great armor if he has set out in the armor of the emptiness of the conditioned and the unconditioned.

original: mig ni mig gis stong /
analyzed: mig ni mig gis stong /
translated: The Lord: So it is, Subhuti, so it is.🔽Subhuti: As I understand the meaning of the Lord's teaching,🔽the Bodhisattva, the great being, should be known as one who has set out in the great armor if he has set out in the armor of the emptiness of the past, the future, and the present.🔽The Lord: So it

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ni yid kyis stong /
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ni yid kyis stong /
translated: the ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind are empty of mind.

original: gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong /
analyzed: gzugs ni gzugs kyis stong /
translated: Form is empty of form.

original: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos ni chos kyis stong /
analyzed: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos ni chos kyis stong /
translated: Sounds, smells, tastes, textures, and mental phenomena are empty of mental phenomena.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pas stong /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pas stong /
translated: The eye consciousness is empty of eye consciousness.

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pas stong /
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pas stong /
translated: The ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind consciousnesses are empty of mind consciousness.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa ni mig gi 'dus te reg pas stong /
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa ni mig gi 'dus te reg pas stong /
translated: Eye contact is empty of eye contact.

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa ni yid kyi 'dus te reg pas stong /🔽mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba ni /
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa ni yid kyi 'dus te reg pas stong / mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba ni /
translated: Ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind contact are empty of mind contact.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor bas stong /
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor bas stong /
translated: The feeling that arises from the condition of eye contact is empty of the feeling that arises from the condition of eye contact.

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba ni yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor bas stong /
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba ni yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor bas stong /
translated: the feeling that arises from the condition of the contact of the ear is empty of the feeling that arises from the condition of the contact of the ear,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas stong /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas stong /
translated: the perfection of giving is empty of the perfection of giving,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar gyis stong /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar gyis stong /
translated: up to the perfection of wisdom is empty of the perfection of wisdom,

original: nang stong pa nyid ni nang stong pa nyid kyis stong /🔽dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid @212b kyi bar ni /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid ni nang stong pa nyid kyis stong / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid @212b kyi bar ni /
translated: inner emptiness is empty of inner emptiness,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyis stong /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar gyis stong /
translated: up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature is empty of the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature,

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams ni dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyis stong /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams ni dran pa nye bar bzhag pa rnams kyis stong /
translated: the applications of mindfulness are empty of the applications of mindfulness,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar gyis stong la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar gyis stong la /
translated: up to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are empty of the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang byang chub sems dpas stong /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang byang chub sems dpas stong /
translated: the bodhisattva is empty of the bodhisattva,

original: go cha chen po'ang go cha chen pos stong pa'i slad du ste /
analyzed: go cha chen po'ang go cha chen pos stong pa'i slad du ste /
translated: and the great armor is empty of the great armor.

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni go cha ma mchis pa'i go cha 'tshal bar rig par bgyi'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs des na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni go cha ma mchis pa'i go cha 'tshal bar rig par bgyi'o //
translated: for this reason, one should know that the bodhisattva great being is the one who dons the armor of non-armor.

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to the venerable Subhūti,

original: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no //🔽de de bzhin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de de bzhin no // de de bzhin te /
translated: “Subhūti, it is so!🔽It is just as you have said!

original: ji skad smras pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji skad smras pa bzhin no //
translated: It is just as you have said.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: rab 'byor / 'di ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni ma byas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di ltar rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni ma byas /
translated: Subhūti, it is because the knowledge of all aspects is not made,

original: ma bshig / mngon par 'dus ma byas la /
analyzed: ma bshig / mngon par 'dus ma byas la /
translated: not destroyed, and not brought together,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gang dag gi don du go cha chen po bgos pa'i sems can de dag kyang ma byas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gang dag gi don du go cha chen po bgos pa'i sems can de dag kyang ma byas /
translated: and those beings for whose sake the bodhisattva great beings don the great armor are also not made,🔽not destroyed, and not brought together.

original: ma bshig / mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma bshig / mngon par 'dus ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not created, not destroyed, and does not undergo any transformation.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti replied,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ci'i slad du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma bgyis /
analyzed: ci'i slad du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma bgyis /
translated: why is the knowledge of all aspects not created,

original: ma bshig / mngon par 'dus ma bgyis shing /🔽byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gang dag gi don du go cha chen po 'tshal ba'i @213a *//
analyzed: ma bshig / mngon par 'dus ma bgyis shing / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos gang dag gi don du go cha chen po 'tshal ba'i @213a *//
translated: not destroyed, and does not undergo any transformation?

original: sems can de dag kyang ma bgyis /
analyzed: sems can de dag kyang ma bgyis /
translated: And why are those sentient beings for whose sake the bodhisattva great beings don the great armor not created,

original: ma bshig / mngon par 'dus ma bgyis pa lags /
analyzed: ma bshig / mngon par 'dus ma bgyis pa lags /
translated: not destroyed, and do not undergo any transformation?”

analyzed: ma bshig / mngon par 'dus ma byas pa yin no //

original: mi 'jig / mngon par 'du mi byed /
analyzed: mi 'jig / mngon par 'du mi byed /

analyzed: mi 'jig / mngon par 'du mi byed /

analyzed: mi 'jig / mngon par 'du mi byed /

analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni mi byed /

original: mi 'jig / mngon par 'du mi byed /
analyzed: mi 'jig / mngon par 'du mi byed /

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa ni mi byed /
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa ni mi byed /

original: mi 'jig / mngon par 'du mi byed /
analyzed: mi 'jig / mngon par 'du mi byed /
translated: They do not cause the ear, nose, tongue, body, or thinking mind to arise.🔽They do not cause the ear, nose, tongue, body, or thinking mind to cease.

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / @213b yid kyi 'dus te reg pa ni mi byed /🔽mi 'jig / mngon par 'du mi byed /
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / @213b yid kyi 'dus te reg pa ni mi byed / mi 'jig / mngon par 'du mi byed /
translated: They do not cause the ear, nose, tongue, body, or thinking mind to become manifest.🔽They do not cause the sensory element of the eyes to arise.🔽They do not cause the sensory element of the eyes to cease.🔽They do not cause the sensory element of the eyes to become manifest.

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba ni mi byed /
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba ni mi byed /
translated: They do not cause the sensory element of sights to arise.🔽They do not cause the sensory element of sights to cease.

original: mi 'jig / mngon par 'du mi byed /
analyzed: mi 'jig / mngon par 'du mi byed /
translated: They do not cause the sensory element of sights to become manifest.🔽They do not cause the sensory element of eye consciousness to arise.🔽They do not cause the sensory element of eye consciousness to cease.🔽They do not cause the sensory element of eye consciousness to become manifest.🔽They do not cause the sensory element of the ears to arise.🔽They do not cause the sensory element of the ears to cease.🔽They do not cause the sensory element of the ears to become manifest.

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba ni mi byed /
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba ni mi byed /
translated: They do not cause the sensory element of sounds to arise.🔽They do not cause the sensory element of sounds to cease.

original: mi 'jig / mngon par 'du mi byed pa'i phyir ro //🔽rab 'byor / bdag ni mi byed /
analyzed: mi 'jig / mngon par 'du mi byed pa'i phyir ro // rab 'byor / bdag ni mi byed /
translated: They do not cause the sensory element of sounds to become manifest.🔽They do not cause the sensory element of ear consciousness to arise.🔽They do not cause the sensory element of ear consciousness to cease.🔽They do not cause the sensory element of ear consciousness to become manifest.🔽They do not cause the sensory element of the nose to arise.

original: mi 'jig / mngon par 'du mi byed /
analyzed: mi 'jig / mngon par 'du mi byed /
translated: They do not cause the sensory element of the nose to cease.

original: sems can dang / srog dang / shes pa po dang / mthong ba po'i bar ni mi byed /
analyzed: sems can dang / srog dang / shes pa po dang / mthong ba po'i bar ni mi byed /
translated: They do not cause the sensory element of the nose to become manifest.🔽They do not cause the sensory element of smells to arise.🔽They do not cause the sensory element of smells to cease.

original: mi 'jig / mngon par 'du mi byed do //🔽de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: mi 'jig / mngon par 'du mi byed do // de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: They do not cause the sensory element of smells to become manifest.🔽They do not cause the sensory element of nose consciousness to arise.🔽They do not cause the sensory element of nose consciousness to cease.

original: 'di ltar de dag gtan med cing mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro; ;rab 'byor /🔽rmi lam ni mi byed /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag gtan med cing mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro; ;rab 'byor / rmi lam ni mi byed /
translated: They do not cause the sensory element of nose consciousness to become manifest.🔽They do not cause the sensory element of the tongue to arise.🔽They do not cause the sensory element of the tongue to cease.🔽They do not cause the sensory element of the tongue to become manifest.🔽They do not cause the sensory element of tastes to arise.

original: mi 'jig / mngon par 'du mi byed do //
analyzed: mi 'jig / mngon par 'du mi byed do //
translated: They do not cause the sensory element of tastes to cease.🔽They do not cause

original: sgyu ma dang / brag ca dang / mig yor dang / gzugs brnyan dang / smig rgyu dang / sprul pa ni mi byed /
analyzed: sgyu ma dang / brag ca dang / mig yor dang / gzugs brnyan dang / smig rgyu dang / sprul pa ni mi byed /
translated: He does not create an illusion, an echo, an optical aberration, a reflected image, a mirage, or a magical creation,

original: mi 'jig / mngon par 'du mi byed do //
analyzed: mi 'jig / mngon par 'du mi byed do //
translated: nor does he destroy them.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: 'di ltar de dag gtan med cing mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag gtan med cing mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are absolutely nonexistent and non-apprehensible.

original: rab 'byor / nang stong pa nyid ni mi byed /
analyzed: rab 'byor / nang stong pa nyid ni mi byed /
translated: Subhūti, the emptiness of internal phenomena does not create

original: mi 'jig / mngon par 'du mi byed do //
analyzed: mi 'jig / mngon par 'du mi byed do //
translated: nor does it destroy or cause anything to be apprehended.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

analyzed: 'di ltar de gtan med cing mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is absolutely nonexistent and non-apprehensible.

analyzed: rab 'byor / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar ni mi byed /
translated: Subhūti, the other aspects of emptiness, up to and including the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities, do not create

original: mi 'jig / mngon par 'du mi byed do //
analyzed: mi 'jig / mngon par 'du mi byed do //
translated: nor do they destroy or cause anything to be apprehended.

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
