original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: ma 'ongs pa'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / ma 'ongs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / ma 'ongs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: future feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are neither bound nor liberated.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: da ltar byung ba'i gzugs ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i gzugs ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: present form is neither bound nor liberated.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: da ltar byung ba'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / da ltar byung pa'i rnam par shes pa ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / da ltar byung pa'i rnam par shes pa ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: present feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are neither bound nor liberated.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: gzugs @215b nyid med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs @215b nyid med pa'i phyir /
translated: because form itself does not exist,

original: gzugs de ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs de ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: that form is neither bound nor liberated.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams med pa dang / rnam par shes pa nyid med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams med pa dang / rnam par shes pa nyid med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness themselves do not exist,

original: rnam par shes pa de ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: Consciousness is neither bound nor liberated.

original: de bzhin du gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa dben pa dang / zhi ba dang / stong pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa dben pa dang / zhi ba dang / stong pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med pa dang /
translated: Similarly, form, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness are isolated, peaceful, empty, signless, wishless, and not occasioning anything;

original: skye ba med pa'i phyir ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba med pa'i phyir ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: because of non-production, they are neither bound nor liberated.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: gzugs dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: gzugs dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa dang /
translated: virtuous and non-virtuous form, with afflictions and without afflictions, reprehensible and irreproachable, with fluxes and without fluxes,

original: zag pa med pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: mundane and supramundane, thoroughly afflicted and completely purified, are neither bound nor liberated.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzugs nyid med pa'i phyir gzugs de ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs nyid med pa'i phyir gzugs de ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: Form is not bound and not liberated because form does not exist.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /🔽de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa dge ba'am /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po / de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa dge ba'am /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: mi dge ba nas rnam par byang ba'i bar yang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba nas rnam par byang ba'i bar yang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: in the same way, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness, whether wholesome or unwholesome, are not bound and not liberated.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rnam par shes pa nyid med pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa de ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nyid med pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa de ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: Consciousness is not bound and not liberated because consciousness does not exist.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: chos thams cad kyang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: all dharmas are not bound and not liberated.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽chos thams cad med pa'i phyir ma bcings @216a *//
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / chos thams cad med pa'i phyir ma bcings @216a *//
translated: Why is that?

original: ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: ma grol ba'o //
translated: All dharmas are not bound and not liberated because they do not exist.

original: de bzhin du dben pa la sogs pa'i phyir ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dben pa la sogs pa'i phyir ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: In the same way, they are not bound and not liberated because they are isolated, and so on.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: the perfection of giving is not bound and not liberated.

original: de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang ma bcings ma grol ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang ma bcings ma grol ba ste /
translated: Similarly, the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of meditation, and the perfection of wisdom are not bound and are not freed.

original: med pa'i phyir ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: Because they do not exist, they are not bound and are not freed.

original: dben pa la sogs pa'i phyir ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: dben pa la sogs pa'i phyir ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: Because they are isolated, they are not bound and are not freed.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: nang stong pa nyid kyang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid kyang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: inner emptiness is not bound and is not freed.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du'ang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyi bar du'ang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: up to the emptiness that is the nonexistence of an intrinsic nature is not bound and is not freed.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun yang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening are not bound and are not freed.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi'i bar dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du'ang ma bcings ma grol ba ste /
analyzed: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi'i bar dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad kyi bar du'ang ma bcings ma grol ba ste /
translated: up to the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, up to the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha are not bound and are not freed.

original: med pa'i phyir ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: Because they do not exist, they are not bound and are not freed.

original: dben pa la sogs pa'i phyir ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: dben pa la sogs pa'i phyir ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: Because they are isolated, they are not bound and are not freed.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: byang chub kyang ma bcings ma grol ba /
analyzed: byang chub kyang ma bcings ma grol ba /
translated: awakening also is not bound and is not freed.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang ma bcings ma grol ba /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang ma bcings ma grol ba /
translated: The knowledge of all aspects also is not bound and is not freed.

original: byang chub sems dpa' yang ma bcings ma grol ba ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' yang ma bcings ma grol ba ste /
translated: A bodhisattva also is not bound and is not freed.

original: med pa'i phyir ma @216b bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir ma @216b bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: Because they do not exist, they are not bound and are not freed.

original: dben pa'i phyir ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: dben pa'i phyir ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: Because they are isolated, they are not bound and are not freed.

original: skye ba med pa'i phyir ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba med pa'i phyir ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: Because they are non-arisen, they are not bound and are not freed.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: de bzhin nyid kyang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: suchness also is not bound and is not freed.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / chos nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / chos gnas pa nyid dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' yang ma bcings ma grol ba ste /
analyzed: ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / chos nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / chos gnas pa nyid dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' yang ma bcings ma grol ba ste /
translated: the unerring suchness, the unaltered suchness, the true nature of dharmas, the dharma-constituent, the establishment of dharmas, the certification of dharmas, and the very limit of reality are not bound and are not freed.

original: med pa dang dben pa'i phyir ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: med pa dang dben pa'i phyir ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: Because of nonexistence and isolation, they are not bound and are not freed.

original: skye ba med pa'i phyir ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: skye ba med pa'i phyir ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: Because of nonproduction, they are not bound and are not freed.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: thus bodhisattva great beings are not bound and are not freed.

original: de ltar na pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag kyang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar na pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag kyang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: Thus the six perfections are not bound and are not freed.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i bar dag kyang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa'i bar dag kyang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: up to the knowledge of all aspects is not bound and is not freed.

original: sems can gang dag yongs su mya ngan las bzla bar 'gyur ba de dag kyang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: sems can gang dag yongs su mya ngan las bzla bar 'gyur ba de dag kyang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: Those beings who are freed from suffering are also not bound and are not freed.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gang dag dag par bya bar 'gyur ba de dag kyang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing gang dag dag par bya bar 'gyur ba de dag kyang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: Those buddhafields that they will purify are also neither bound nor liberated.

original: bsnyen bkur bya bar 'gyur ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: bsnyen bkur bya bar 'gyur ba'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: The lord buddhas whom they will serve are also neither bound nor liberated.

original: thos par 'gyur ba'i chos kyang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: thos par 'gyur ba'i chos kyang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: The Dharma that they will hear is also neither bound nor liberated.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang nam yang bral bar mi 'gyur ba'ang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang nam yang bral bar mi 'gyur ba'ang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: They will never be separated from the lord buddhas and that is also neither bound nor liberated.

original: mngon par shes pa rnams dang bral bar mi 'gyur ba dang / mig lnga dang bral bar mi 'gyur ba @217a *//
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams dang bral bar mi 'gyur ba dang / mig lnga dang bral bar mi 'gyur ba @217a *//
translated: They will not be separated from the clairvoyances, they will not be separated from the five eyes,

original: dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang bral bar mi 'gyur ba'ang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: dang / ting nge 'dzin rnams dang bral bar mi 'gyur ba'ang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: they will not be separated from the meditative stabilizations, and that is also neither bound nor liberated.

original: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid bskyed par 'gyur ba'ang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: lam gyi rnam pa shes pa nyid bskyed par 'gyur ba'ang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: The knowledge of path aspects that they will develop is also neither bound nor liberated.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rtogs par 'gyur ba'ang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid rtogs par 'gyur ba'ang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: The realization of the knowledge of all aspects is also neither bound nor liberated.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar 'gyur ba'ang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar 'gyur ba'ang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: the turning of the wheel of Dharma is neither bound nor liberated;

original: theg pa gsum po dag gis sems can rnams yongs su mya ngan las bzla bar 'gyur ba'ang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
analyzed: theg pa gsum po dag gis sems can rnams yongs su mya ngan las bzla bar 'gyur ba'ang ma bcings ma grol ba'o //
translated: the full liberation of sentient beings through the three vehicles is neither bound nor liberated.

original: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa gang po /
translated: Venerable Pūrṇa,

original: med pa dang / dben pa dang / skye ba med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar ma bcings ma grol ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag gis chos thams cad mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: med pa dang / dben pa dang / skye ba med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de ltar ma bcings ma grol ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag gis chos thams cad mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: because of non-existence, isolation, and non-arising, the bodhisattva mahāsattva, neither bound nor liberated, will fully awaken to all dharmas through the six perfections.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
translated: In the Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines,

original: ma bcings ma grol ba'i le'u zhes bya ste bcu bzhi pa'o ////🔽de nas bcom ldan 'das la /
analyzed: ma bcings ma grol ba'i le'u zhes bya ste bcu bzhi pa'o //// de nas bcom ldan 'das la /
translated: this is the fourteenth chapter, “Neither Bound Nor Liberated.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the Blessed One:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i thig pa chen po ni gang lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i thig pa chen po ni gang lags /
translated: what is the great armor of the bodhisattva mahāsattva?

original: bcom ldan 'das ji tsam gyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs par rig par bgyi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ji tsam gyis byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs par rig par bgyi /
translated: Blessed One, by what means should one know that a bodhisattva great being has set out in the Great Vehicle?

original: theg pa de ni gang la yang dag par zhugs pa lags /
analyzed: theg pa de ni gang la yang dag par zhugs pa lags /
translated: What is the vehicle in which they have set out?

original: theg pa de ni gang du gnas par 'gyur ba lags /
analyzed: theg pa de ni gang du gnas par 'gyur ba lags /
translated: Where will they come to rest in that vehicle?

original: theg pa des ni su zhig nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba @217b lags /🔽de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: theg pa des ni su zhig nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba @217b lags / de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: Who will definitely emerge by means of that vehicle?

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: When he had thus requested, the Blessed One said this to the venerable Subhūti:

original: rab 'byor / khyod gang 'di skad du /
analyzed: rab 'byor / khyod gang 'di skad du /
translated: “Subhūti, you have asked:

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: ‘Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni gang lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni gang lags /
translated: what is the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva great beings?

original: zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: zhes zer ba ni /
translated: This is what they say.🔽🔽

original: rab 'byor / pha rol tu phyin pa drug ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / pha rol tu phyin pa drug ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po yin te /
translated: Subhūti, the six perfections are the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva great beings.

original: drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: the perfection of generosity, the perfection of moral discipline, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, the perfection of meditative stabilization, and the perfection of wisdom.

original: de la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the perfection of generosity?”

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa dag gis /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa dag gis / 'di lta ste /
translated: “Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings, with thoughts connected with the knowledge of all aspects,🔽give gifts

original: phyi dang nang gi dngos po rnams sbyin pa sbyin par byed cing /
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi dngos po rnams sbyin pa sbyin par byed cing /
translated: of outer and inner things,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dag kyang sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo bar byed pa ste /
translated: and, having made those wholesome roots into something shared in common by all sentient beings, they dedicate them to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, using a dedication formula that does not apprehend anything.

original: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
translated: That is the bodhisattva great beings’ perfection of giving.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang lags /
translated: what is the bodhisattva great beings’ perfection of morality?”

original: bcom @218a *// ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom @218a *// ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa dag gis mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bdag kyang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par blangs shing gnas la /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa dag gis mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis bdag kyang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par blangs shing gnas la /
translated: “Here, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings, with thoughts connected with the knowledge of all aspects, having taken up and lived by the ten wholesome actions themselves,

original: sems can gzhan dag kyang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing 'dzud de rab tu 'god par byed pa de ni /
analyzed: sems can gzhan dag kyang dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing 'dzud de rab tu 'god par byed pa de ni /
translated: introduce other beings to the ten wholesome actions and establish them in them, and do so without apprehending anything.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nag nog med pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa nag nog med pa yin no //
translated: This is the bodhisattva great beings’ untarnished perfection of morality.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol ba /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol ba /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang lags /
translated: what is the bodhisattva great beings’ perfection of patience?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa dag gis /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa dag gis /
translated: “Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings, with the thought that is the union of the knowledge of all aspects,

original: bdag kyang bzod pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan la /
analyzed: bdag kyang bzod pa phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan la /
translated: are themselves endowed with perfect patience,

original: gzhan dag kyang bzod pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang bzod pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing /
translated: and they cause others to take up patience,

original: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byed pa de ni /
analyzed: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byed pa de ni /
translated: and they do so without apprehending anything.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
translated: Subhūti, this is the bodhisattva great beings’ perfection of patience.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang lags /
translated: “What is the bodhisattva great beings’ perfection of perseverance?”

original: bcom ldan 'das @218b kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das @218b kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed bdag gis bdag kyang pha rol tu phyin pa lnga la brtson pa mi 'dor zhing /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed bdag gis bdag kyang pha rol tu phyin pa lnga la brtson pa mi 'dor zhing /
translated: “Here, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings with the thought of awakening connected with the knowledge of all aspects do not give up striving at the five perfections themselves

original: gzhan dag kyang pha rol tu phyin pa lnga yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang pha rol tu phyin pa lnga yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug ste /
translated: and introduce others to the five perfections

original: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byed pa de ni /
analyzed: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byed pa de ni /
translated: and do that without taking anything as a basis.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
translated: That, Subhūti, is the bodhisattva great beings’ perfection of perseverance.”

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti said,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang lags /
translated: what is the bodhisattva great beings’ perfection of concentration?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord said,

original: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa dag gis thabs la mkhas pas bdag kyang bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug cing /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa dag gis thabs la mkhas pas bdag kyang bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug cing /
translated: “Subhūti, here, with the production of the thought endowed with the knowledge of all aspects, bodhisattva great beings, skilled in means, themselves enter into the dhyānas,

original: de dag gi dbang gis kyang mi skye la /
analyzed: de dag gi dbang gis kyang mi skye la /
translated: and they do not take rebirth through their power,

original: gzhan dag kyang bsam gtan rnams yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang bsam gtan rnams yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug ste /
translated: and they also inspire others to take up the dhyānas,

original: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byed pa de ni /
analyzed: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis byed pa de ni /
translated: and they do that without apprehending anything.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin no //
translated: Subhūti, that is the bodhisattva great beings’ perfection of dhyāna.

original: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis gsol pa /
translated: Subhūti then asked,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Lord,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang lags /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang lags /
translated: what is the bodhisattva great beings’ perfection of wisdom?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal ba /
translated: The Lord said,🔽“Subhūti, here, with the production of the thought endowed with the knowledge of all aspects, bodhisattva great beings, skilled in means, themselves enter into the dhyānas,🔽and they do not take rebirth through their power,🔽and they also inspire others to take up the dhyānas,🔽and they do that without apprehending anything.

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa @219a *//
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnam pa @219a *//
translated: Subhūti, that is the bodhisattva great beings’ perfection of dhyāna.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa dag gis mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med pa dang / chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin la so sor rtog par byed cing /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang ldan pa'i sems bskyed pa dag gis mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis chos thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med pa dang / chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin la so sor rtog par byed cing /
translated: and with the generation of the mind that is endowed with omniscience, they are without attachment to all phenomena by way of non-apprehension, and they discern the nature of all phenomena.

original: gzhan dag kyang chos thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med pa dang / chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin la so sor rtog pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa de ni /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang chos thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med pa dang / chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin la so sor rtog pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa de ni /
translated: And they also cause others to take up the absence of attachment to all phenomena and the discernment of the nature of all phenomena.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin te /
translated: Subhūti, that is the bodhisattva great beings’ perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po yin no ////
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po yin no ////
translated: Subhūti, that is the bodhisattva great beings’ Great Vehicle.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa /
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines

original: bam po bcu gcig pa /
analyzed: bam po bcu gcig pa /
translated: Fascicle Eleven

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, the bodhisattva great beings’ Great Vehicle is as follows:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is this.

original: nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang / chen po stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid dang / stong pa nyid stong pa nyid dang / chen po stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid dang / 'dus byas stong pa nyid dang /
translated: the emptiness of internal phenomena, the emptiness of external phenomena, the emptiness of both external and internal phenomena, the emptiness of emptiness, the emptiness of great extent, the emptiness of ultimate reality, the emptiness of conditioned phenomena,

original: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid dang / mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid dang / thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid dang / dor ba med pa stong pa nyid dang / rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid dang / chos thams cad stong pa nyid dang /
translated: the emptiness of unconditioned phenomena, the emptiness of the unlimited, the emptiness of that which has neither beginning nor end, the emptiness of non-dispersal, the emptiness of inherent existence, the emptiness of all phenomena,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid stong pa @219b nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid dang / mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa stong pa nyid dang / ngo bo nyid stong pa @219b nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yin no //
translated: the emptiness of intrinsic characteristics, the emptiness of non-apprehension, the emptiness of non-entities, the emptiness of essential nature, and the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities.

original: de la nang stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la nang stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the emptiness of internal phenomena?

original: nang gi chos rnams te /
analyzed: nang gi chos rnams te /
translated: Internal phenomena are

original: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid de /
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid de /
translated: the eye, the ear, the nose, the tongue, the body, and the thinking mind.🔽In this regard, the eye is empty of the eye,

original: de la ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /🔽mig ni mig gis stong ngo //
analyzed: de la ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir / mig ni mig gis stong ngo //
translated: because of its non-fixation and non-destruction.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir ro // ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: That is its nature.🔽The ear is empty of the ear,

original: rna ba rna bas stong ngo //
analyzed: rna ba rna bas stong ngo //
translated: because of its non-fixation and non-destruction.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir ro // ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: That is its nature.🔽The nose is empty of the nose,

original: sna ni snas stong ngo //
analyzed: sna ni snas stong ngo //
translated: because of its non-fixation and non-destruction.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is its nature.🔽The tongue is empty of the tongue,

original: ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /🔽lce ni lces stong ngo //
analyzed: ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir / lce ni lces stong ngo //
translated: because of its non-fixation and non-destruction.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir ro; ;ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir ro; ;ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because that is the nature of form.

original: lus ni lus kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: lus ni lus kyis stong ngo //
translated: The body is empty of the body.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is the nature of the body.

original: ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang; 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang; 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is neither unmoved nor destroyed,

original: yid ni yid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: yid ni yid kyis stong ngo //
translated: the mind is empty of the mind.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because that is the nature of the mind.

original: de ni nang stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni nang stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the emptiness of inner phenomena.

original: de la phyi stong pa nyid gang zhe na /🔽phyi rol gyi chos rnams te /
analyzed: de la phyi stong pa nyid gang zhe na / phyi rol gyi chos rnams te /
translated: “What is the emptiness of outer phenomena?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Outer phenomena are as follows:

original: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams so //
analyzed: gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams so //
translated: form, sound, smell, taste, touch, and mental phenomena.

original: de la ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are neither unmoved nor destroyed,

original: gzugs @220a *// ni gzugs kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs @220a *// ni gzugs kyis stong ngo //
translated: form is empty of form.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is the nature of form.

original: de bzhin du ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Likewise, because of non-enduring and non-perishing,

original: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos ni chos kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos ni chos kyis stong ngo //
translated: sound, smell, taste, touch, and mental objects are empty of mental objects.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because that is their nature.

original: de ni phyi stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni phyi stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: That is called the emptiness of the external.

original: de la phyi nang stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la phyi nang stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the emptiness of the external and internal?

original: nang gi skye mched drug dang / phyi'i skye mched drug po de dag ni phyi dang nang gi chos rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nang gi skye mched drug dang / phyi'i skye mched drug po de dag ni phyi dang nang gi chos rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: The six internal sense-spheres and the six external sense-spheres are called internal and external phenomena.

original: de la nang gi chos rnams phyi'i chos rnams kyis stong pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la nang gi chos rnams phyi'i chos rnams kyis stong pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the emptiness of internal phenomena by external phenomena?

original: ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of non-enduring and non-perishing,

original: nang gi mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid rnams ni phyi'i gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: nang gi mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid rnams ni phyi'i gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams kyis stong ngo //
translated: the internal eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind are empty of external forms, sounds, smells, tastes, touches, and mental objects.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is its nature.

original: ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of non-enduring and non-perishing,

original: phyi rol gyi chos gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams ni nang gi chos mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid rnams kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi chos gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang / ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams ni nang gi chos mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid rnams kyis stong ngo //
translated: external phenomena such as form, sound, smell, taste, touch, and mental objects are empty of internal phenomena such as the eyes, ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because that is its nature.

original: de ni phyi nang stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni phyi nang stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the emptiness of external and internal phenomena.

original: de la stong pa nyid stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la stong pa nyid stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the emptiness of emptiness?

original: ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of non-enduring and non-perishing,

original: chos @220b thams cad kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa'i stong pa nyid des stong pa nyid stong pa'o //
analyzed: chos @220b thams cad kyi stong pa nyid gang yin pa'i stong pa nyid des stong pa nyid stong pa'o //
translated: the emptiness of all phenomena is empty of that emptiness.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because that is its nature.

original: de ni stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni stong pa nyid stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the emptiness of emptiness.

original: de la chen po stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la chen po stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the emptiness of the great?

original: ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of the nonexistence of permanence and the nonexistence of destruction,

original: shar phyogs ni shar phyogs kyis stong /🔽lho phyogs ni lho phyogs kyis stong /
analyzed: shar phyogs ni shar phyogs kyis stong / lho phyogs ni lho phyogs kyis stong /
translated: the east is empty of the east.🔽The south is empty of the south.

original: nub phyogs ni nub phyogs kyis stong /🔽byang phyogs ni byang phyogs kyis stong /🔽'og gi phyogs ni 'og gi phyogs kyis stong /
analyzed: nub phyogs ni nub phyogs kyis stong / byang phyogs ni byang phyogs kyis stong / 'og gi phyogs ni 'og gi phyogs kyis stong /
translated: The west is empty of the west.🔽The north is empty of the north.🔽The nadir is empty of the nadir.

original: steng gi phyogs ni steng gi phyogs kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: steng gi phyogs ni steng gi phyogs kyis stong ngo //
translated: The zenith is empty of the zenith.

original: de bzhin du phyogs mtshams rnams ni phyogs mtshams rnams kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyogs mtshams rnams ni phyogs mtshams rnams kyis stong ngo //
translated: In the same way, the intermediate directions are empty of the intermediate directions.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because of the nonexistence of permanence and the nonexistence of destruction.

original: de ni chen po stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni chen po stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the emptiness of the great.

original: de la don dam pa stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la don dam pa stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the emptiness of the ultimate?

original: don dam pa zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: don dam pa zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: The ultimate is nirvana.

original: ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because nirvana is not permanent, not impermanent, not coming, not going, not produced, not non-produced, not ceasing, and not non-ceasing,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa de'ang mya ngan las 'das pas stong ngo //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa de'ang mya ngan las 'das pas stong ngo //
translated: that nirvana is empty of nirvana.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir te; de ni don dam pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir te; de ni don dam pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Because that is its nature. This is called the emptiness of the ultimate.

original: de la 'dus byas stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'dus byas stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the emptiness of the conditioned?

original: 'dus byas zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams te; de la ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dus byas zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams te; de la ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: The conditioned is the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm. Because they are not permanent and not ceasing,

original: 'dod pa'i khams ni 'dod pa'i khams kyis stong /🔽gzugs kyi khams ni gzugs kyi khams kyis stong /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams ni 'dod pa'i khams kyis stong / gzugs kyi khams ni gzugs kyi khams kyis stong /
translated: the desire realm is empty of the desire realm.🔽The form realm is empty of the form realm.

original: gzugs @221a *// med pa'i khams ni gzugs med pa'i khams kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs @221a *// med pa'i khams ni gzugs med pa'i khams kyis stong ngo //
translated: The formless realm is empty of the formless realm.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because that is their nature.

original: de ni 'dus byas stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni 'dus byas stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the emptiness of the conditioned.

original: de la 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the emptiness of the uncompounded?

original: de la 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Here, the uncompounded is

original: gang la skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa dang / gnas pa med pa dang / gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa de ni 'dus ma byas pa ste /
analyzed: gang la skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa dang / gnas pa med pa dang / gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa de ni 'dus ma byas pa ste /
translated: that which has no production, no cessation, no destruction, no abiding, and no transformation.

original: ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is neither single nor plural,

original: 'dus ma byas de'ang 'dus ma byas kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas de'ang 'dus ma byas kyis stong ngo //
translated: the uncompounded is empty of the uncompounded.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because that is its nature.

original: de ni 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni 'dus ma byas stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the emptiness of the uncompounded.

original: de la mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid gang zhe na /🔽gang la mtha' mi dmigs pa de ni mtha' las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: de la mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid gang zhe na / gang la mtha' mi dmigs pa de ni mtha' las 'das pa ste /
translated: “What is the emptiness of beyond extremes?

original: ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: The extreme of eternalism is not apprehended in it, nor is the extreme of nihilism apprehended in it.🔽Because it is neither single nor plural,

original: mtha' ni mthas stong ngo //
analyzed: mtha' ni mthas stong ngo //
translated: beyond extremes is empty of beyond extremes.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because that is its nature.

original: de ni mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni mtha' las 'das pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: This is called “emptiness of what is beyond extremes.”

original: de la thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la thog ma dang tha ma med pa stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: “What is emptiness of no beginning or end?

original: gang la thog ma dang tha ma mi dmigs pa de la dbus med cing /
analyzed: gang la thog ma dang tha ma mi dmigs pa de la dbus med cing /
translated: That which cannot be observed as having a beginning or an end also cannot be observed as having a middle.

original: gang la thog ma dang tha ma dang dbus med pa de la 'ong ba dang 'gro ba med pa ste /
analyzed: gang la thog ma dang tha ma dang dbus med pa de la 'ong ba dang 'gro ba med pa ste /
translated: That which has no beginning, no end, and no middle also has no coming or going.

original: ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is neither stable nor destroyed,

original: thog ma dang dbus dang tha ma rnams ni /
analyzed: thog ma dang dbus dang tha ma rnams ni /
translated: the beginning, middle, and end

original: thog ma dang dbus dang tha ma rnams kyis stong ste /
analyzed: thog ma dang dbus dang tha ma rnams kyis stong ste /
translated: are empty of the beginning, middle, and end.

original: de ni thog ma dang tha @221b ma med pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni thog ma dang tha @221b ma med pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: This is called “emptiness of no beginning or end.”

original: de la dor ba med pa stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dor ba med pa stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: “What is emptiness of non-apprehension?

original: chos gang la'ang dor du med pa ste /
analyzed: chos gang la'ang dor du med pa ste /
translated: There is nothing to be apprehended in any phenomenon.

original: ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is neither stable nor destroyed,

original: dor ba med pa ni dor ba med pas stong ngo //
analyzed: dor ba med pa ni dor ba med pas stong ngo //
translated: non-apprehension is empty of non-apprehension.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because that is its nature.

original: de ni dor ba med pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni dor ba med pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: This is called “emptiness of what is not to be discarded.

original: de la rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid gang zhe na /🔽'dus byas sam /
analyzed: de la rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid gang zhe na / 'dus byas sam /
translated: “What is emptiness of inherent existence?🔽The inherent existence of all conditioned and unconditioned phenomena

original: 'dus ma byas kyi chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni nyan thos kyis ma byas /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni nyan thos kyis ma byas /
translated: is not created by the Hearers,

original: rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis ma byas /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis ma byas /
translated: not created by the Solitary Realizers,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ma byas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis ma byas /
translated: not created by the Bodhisattvas,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis ma mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis ma mdzad pa ste /
translated: and not created by the Tathāgatas, the Saints, the genuinely and fully awake Buddhas.

original: ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are not stable and not destroyed,

original: rang bzhin ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni rang bzhin gyis stong ngo //
translated: inherent existence is empty of inherent existence.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because that is its nature.

original: de ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: This is called “emptiness of inherent existence.

original: de la chos thams cad stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la chos thams cad stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: “What is emptiness of all things?

original: chos thams cad ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad ces bya ba ni /
translated: All things are

original: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa dang / mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid dang / gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang /
analyzed: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa dang / mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid dang / gzugs dang / sgra dang / dri dang /
translated: form,🔽feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness; the eyes, ears, nose, tongue, body, and mind; form, sound, smell, taste,

original: ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang /
analyzed: ro dang / reg bya dang / chos rnams dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / rna ba'i rnam par shes pa dang / sna'i rnam par shes pa dang / lce'i rnam par shes pa dang / lus kyi rnam par shes pa dang /
translated: tactile objects, and mental phenomena; the eye consciousness, ear consciousness, nose consciousness, tongue consciousness, body consciousness,

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa dang / rna @222a *//
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa dang / rna @222a *//
translated: and mind consciousness; eye contact,

original: ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang /
analyzed: ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa dang / mig gi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba dang /
translated: ear contact, nose contact, tongue contact, body contact, and mind contact; the feeling that arises from the condition of eye contact, the feeling that arises from the condition of ear contact, the feeling that arises from the condition of nose contact, the feeling that arises from the condition of tongue contact, the feeling that arises from the condition of body contact, and the feeling that arises from the condition of mind contact;

original: gzugs can gyi chos rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i chos rnams dang / 'dus byas kyi chos rnams dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos de dag ni chos thams cad ces bya ste /🔽de la ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs can gyi chos rnams dang / gzugs med pa'i chos rnams dang / 'dus byas kyi chos rnams dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos de dag ni chos thams cad ces bya ste / de la ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: The form dharmas, the formless dharmas, the conditioned dharmas, and the unconditioned dharmas are called all dharmas.

original: chos thams cad ni chos thams cad kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni chos thams cad kyis stong ngo //
translated: In them, all dharmas are empty of all dharmas because they do not endure permanently and they do not disintegrate.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: That is their intrinsic nature.

original: de ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni chos thams cad stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the emptiness of all dharmas.

original: de la rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the emptiness of its own mark?

original: gzugs kyi mtshan nyid ni gzugs su rung ba /
analyzed: gzugs kyi mtshan nyid ni gzugs su rung ba /
translated: The mark of form is to be able to assume a form.

original: tshor ba'i mtshan nyid ni myong ba /
analyzed: tshor ba'i mtshan nyid ni myong ba /
translated: The mark of feeling is to experience.

original: 'du shes kyi mtshan nyid ni 'dzin par byed pa /
analyzed: 'du shes kyi mtshan nyid ni 'dzin par byed pa /
translated: The mark of perception is to apprehend.

original: 'du byed rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni mngon par 'du byed pa /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyi mtshan nyid ni mngon par 'du byed pa /
translated: The mark of volitional factors is to form.

original: rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam par shes par byed pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam par shes par byed pa ste /
translated: The mark of consciousness is to be conscious.

original: ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang // 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang // 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: not subject to annihilation,

original: 'dus byas kyi chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa'i chos de dag thams cad ni rang rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa dang / 'dus ma byas kyi chos rnams kyi mtshan nyid gang yin pa'i chos de dag thams cad ni rang rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong ngo //
translated: all these phenomena, the characteristics of conditioned phenomena and the characteristics of unconditioned phenomena, are empty of their own characteristics.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because that is their nature.

original: de ni rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni rang gi mtshan nyid stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the emptiness of defining characteristics.

original: de la mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the emptiness of nonobservation?

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa @222b dang; da ltar byung ba'i chos gang yin pa de dag ni dmigs su med pa ste /
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa @222b dang; da ltar byung ba'i chos gang yin pa de dag ni dmigs su med pa ste /
translated: Any phenomena of the past, future, or present are not observed.

original: 'das pa rnams ni ma 'ongs pa la mi dmigs /
analyzed: 'das pa rnams ni ma 'ongs pa la mi dmigs /
translated: The past is not observed in the future,

original: ma 'ongs pa rnams kyang 'das pa la mi dmigs /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa rnams kyang 'das pa la mi dmigs /
translated: the future is not observed in the past,

original: da ltar byung ba rnams kyang 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa la mi dmigs so //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba rnams kyang 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa la mi dmigs so //
translated: and the present is not observed in the past and future.

original: ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are not permanent, nor are they annihilated.

original: mi dmigs pa ni mi dmigs pas stong ngo //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa ni mi dmigs pas stong ngo //
translated: The non-apprehension of non-apprehension is empty of the non-apprehension of non-apprehension.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because that is its nature.

original: de ni mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni mi dmigs pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the emptiness of the non-apprehension of non-apprehension.

original: de la dngos po med pa stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dngos po med pa stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities?

original: gang la dngos po 'ga' yang mi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: gang la dngos po 'ga' yang mi dmigs pa ste /
translated: It is the non-apprehension of any entity whatsoever.

original: ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are not permanent, nor are they annihilated.

original: dngos po med pa ni dngos po med pas stong ngo //
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni dngos po med pas stong ngo //
translated: The non-apprehension of an entity is empty of the non-apprehension of an entity.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because that is its nature.

original: de ni dngos po med pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni dngos po med pa stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the emptiness of the essential nature of non-entities.

original: de la ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the emptiness of essential nature?

original: gang la ngo bo nyid 'ga' yang mi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: gang la ngo bo nyid 'ga' yang mi dmigs pa ste /
translated: It is the non-apprehension of any essential nature whatsoever.

original: ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are not permanent, nor are they annihilated.

original: ngo bo nyid ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong ngo //
translated: The intrinsic nature is empty of the intrinsic nature.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because that is its intrinsic nature.

original: de ni ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the emptiness of intrinsic nature.

original: de la dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the emptiness of the essential nature of nonentities?”

original: chos rnams rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir 'dus pa las byung ba'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid med pa ste /
analyzed: chos rnams rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir 'dus pa las byung ba'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid med pa ste /
translated: Because phenomena arise in dependence, the essential nature of phenomena that arise from the combination of causes and conditions does not exist.

original: ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ther zug tu gnas pa med pa dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they do not endure and do not disintegrate,

original: 'dus pa ni 'dus pas stong ngo //
analyzed: 'dus pa ni 'dus pas stong ngo //
translated: the combination is empty of the combination.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why?

original: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir te /🔽de ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin de yin pa'i phyir te / de ni dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa /
translated: Because that is its essential nature.

original: @223a *// nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: @223a *// nyid ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the emptiness of the essential nature of nonentities.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni /🔽dngos po ni dngos pos stong /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni / dngos po ni dngos pos stong /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, the emptiness of the essential nature of nonentities is as follows:🔽An entity is empty of an entity.

original: dngos po med pa ni dngos po med pas steng /
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni dngos po med pas steng /
translated: A nonentity is empty of a nonentity.

original: ngo po nyid ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong /
analyzed: ngo po nyid ni ngo bo nyid kyis stong /
translated: The intrinsic reality is empty of intrinsic reality.

original: gzhan gyi dngos po ni gzhan gyi dngos pos stong pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po ni gzhan gyi dngos pos stong pa ste /
translated: The extrinsic reality is empty of extrinsic reality.

original: de la dngos po gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dngos po gang zhe na /
translated: What is a thing?

original: dngos po zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga ste /
analyzed: dngos po zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga ste /
translated: A thing is the five aggregates.

original: de la phung po lnga po dag ni ma skyes pa'i phyir dmigs su med pas /
analyzed: de la phung po lnga po dag ni ma skyes pa'i phyir dmigs su med pas /
translated: Since the five aggregates are unarisen, they are not apprehended.

original: de ltar dngos po ni dngos pos stong ngo //
analyzed: de ltar dngos po ni dngos pos stong ngo //
translated: Thus a thing is empty of a thing.

original: dngos po med pa'ang dngos po med pas ji ltar stong zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po med pa'ang dngos po med pas ji ltar stong zhe na /
translated: How is a non-thing empty of a non-thing?

original: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas pa ste /🔽de la 'dus ma byas pa'ang 'dus ma byas pas stong pas /
analyzed: dngos po med pa zhes bya ba ni 'dus ma byas pa ste / de la 'dus ma byas pa'ang 'dus ma byas pas stong pas /
translated: A non-thing is the unconditioned.🔽Since the unconditioned is empty of the unconditioned,

original: de ltar na dngos po med pa ni dngos po med pas stong ngo //
analyzed: de ltar na dngos po med pa ni dngos po med pas stong ngo //
translated: thus a non-thing is empty of a non-thing.

original: ji ltar na ngo bo nyid ngo bo nyid kyis stong zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na ngo bo nyid ngo bo nyid kyis stong zhe na /
translated: How is intrinsic reality empty of intrinsic reality?

original: ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: Intrinsic reality is the unmistaken nature.

original: de la stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni shes pas ma byas /
analyzed: de la stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni shes pas ma byas /
translated: In that regard, emptiness is not made by knowing.

original: mthong bas ma byas pas na /
analyzed: mthong bas ma byas pas na /
translated: Since it is not made by seeing,

original: de ni ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: it is called the emptiness of essential nature.

original: de la gzhan gyi dngos po stong pa nyid gang zhe na; gang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung /🔽ma byung yang rung ste /🔽chos gnas pa nyid dang / chos nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang / de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' de ni gnas pa nyid de /🔽de ltar gzhan gyis stong pa gang yin pa de ni gzhan gyi dngos po stong pa @223b nyid ces bya'o //🔽rab 'byor / de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po yin no //
analyzed: de la gzhan gyi dngos po stong pa nyid gang zhe na; gang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams byung yang rung / ma byung yang rung ste / chos gnas pa nyid dang / chos nyid dang / chos kyi dbyings dang / chos skyon med pa nyid dang / de bzhin nyid dang / ma nor ba de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' de ni gnas pa nyid de / de ltar gzhan gyis stong pa gang yin pa de ni gzhan gyi dngos po stong pa @223b nyid ces bya'o // rab 'byor / de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po yin no //
translated: “What is the emptiness of other things? Whether the Tathāgatas arise or not,

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po /🔽'di lta ste /
