original: de la nem nur rnam par sel ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la nem nur rnam par sel ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the meditative stabilization called Dispelling All Doubt?

original: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na chos thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi nem nur rnam par sel ba rjes su 'thob pa ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na chos thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi nem nur rnam par sel ba rjes su 'thob pa ste /
translated: It is the meditative stabilization standing in which one attains the dispelling of all doubt about all dharmas and all meditative stabilizations.

original: de ni nem nur rnam par sel ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni nem nur rnam par sel ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the meditative stabilization called Dispelling All Doubt.

original: de la gnas su bya ba med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la gnas su bya ba med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the meditative stabilization called No Support?

original: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na chos thams cad kyi gnas yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na chos thams cad kyi gnas yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste /
translated: It is the samādhi in which one does not see the basis of any phenomena.

original: de ni gnas su bya ba med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni gnas su bya ba med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
translated: It is called the ‘samādhi that is not a basis.’

original: de la bkod pa gcig pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la bkod pa gcig pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the samādhi called single arrangement?

original: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na chos gang la'ang gnyis su yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na chos gang la'ang gnyis su yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste /
translated: It is the samādhi in which one does not see any phenomena as dual.

original: de ni bkod pa gcig pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni bkod pa gcig pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
translated: It is called the ‘samādhi of single arrangement.’

original: de la rnam pa mngon par sgrub pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rnam pa mngon par sgrub pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the samādhi called accomplishment of aspects?

original: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na chos thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi rnam pa mngon par bsgrub pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na chos thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi rnam pa mngon par bsgrub pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste /
translated: It is the samādhi in which one does not see the accomplishment of the aspects of any phenomena or any samādhis.

original: de ni rnam pa mngon par bsgrub pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa mngon par bsgrub pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
translated: It is called the ‘samādhi of the accomplishment of aspects.’

original: de la rnam pa gcig tu gyur pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /🔽ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na ting nge 'dzin @233a *//
analyzed: de la rnam pa gcig tu gyur pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na / ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na ting nge 'dzin @233a *//
translated: What is the samādhi called “single aspect”?

original: thams cad kyi rnam pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste /
analyzed: thams cad kyi rnam pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste /
translated: It is the samādhi standing in which one does not see any aspect of any samādhi.

original: de'i phyir rnam pa gcig tu gyur pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa gcig tu gyur pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is called the samādhi called “single aspect.”

original: de la rnam pa dor ba med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rnam pa dor ba med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the samādhi called “non-abandonment of aspects”?

original: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na ting nge 'dzin thams cad la gnyis su yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na ting nge 'dzin thams cad la gnyis su yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste /
translated: It is the samādhi standing in which one does not see any duality in any samādhi.

original: de ni rnam pa dor ba med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa dor ba med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is called the samādhi called “non-abandonment of aspects.”

original: de la rtogs pas srid pa'i mun pa thams cad dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rtogs pas srid pa'i mun pa thams cad dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the samādhi called “free from darkness through realization”?

original: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi nges par 'byed pa'i shes pa 'thob cing de thob nas kyang chos 'ga' yang khong du ma chud pa med pa ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi nges par 'byed pa'i shes pa 'thob cing de thob nas kyang chos 'ga' yang khong du ma chud pa med pa ste /
translated: It is called the ‘samādhi of realizing the absence of any phenomena that are not penetrated’ because, when one abides in this samādhi, one attains the knowledge that distinguishes all samādhis, and having attained that, there are no phenomena that are not penetrated.

original: de ni rtogs pas srid pa'i mun pa thams cad dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ni rtogs pas srid pa'i mun pa thams cad dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
translated: It is called the ‘samādhi called free from the darkness of existence through realization’ because, when one abides in this samādhi, one is free from all the darkness of existence.

original: de la brda dang sgra la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la brda dang sgra la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the samādhi called engaging with words and sounds?

original: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi brda dang sgra dag la 'jug par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi brda dang sgra dag la 'jug par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: It is the samādhi abiding in which one engages with the words and sounds of all samādhis.

original: de'i phyir brda dang sgra la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir brda dang sgra la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the ‘samādhi called engaging with words and sounds.’

original: de la sgra dbyangs kyi yi ge dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sgra dbyangs kyi yi ge dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the samādhi called free from the syllables of sound and melody?

original: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na /
translated: It is the samādhi abiding in which one

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad yi ge dang bral bar yang dag par rjes su mthong ba ste; de'i phyir sgra dbyangs kyi yi ge dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad yi ge dang bral bar yang dag par rjes su mthong ba ste; de'i phyir sgra dbyangs kyi yi ge dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
translated: It is the samādhi that is free from the syllables of all sounds and voices.

original: de la sgron ma 'bar ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /🔽ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na ting nge 'dzin @233b thams cad gzi brjid kyis lham me /
analyzed: de la sgron ma 'bar ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na / ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na ting nge 'dzin @233b thams cad gzi brjid kyis lham me /
translated: “What is the jyotiṣprabha samādhi?

original: lhan ne / lhang nger snang ba ste /
analyzed: lhan ne / lhang nger snang ba ste /
translated: It is the samādhi in which all samādhis shine, glow, and gleam.

original: de'i phyir sgron ma 'bar ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgron ma 'bar ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is called the jyotiṣprabha samādhi.

original: de la mtshan nyid yongs su sbyong ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid yongs su sbyong ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the lakṣaṇaparipūraṇa samādhi?

original: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi mtshan nyid yongs su dag par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi mtshan nyid yongs su dag par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: It is the samādhi in which the characteristics of all samādhis are purified.

original: de'i phyir mtshan nyid yongs su sbyong ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshan nyid yongs su sbyong ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is called the lakṣaṇaparipūraṇa samādhi.

original: de la mngon par ma dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la mngon par ma dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the samādhi called ‘non-apprehending’?

original: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na ting nge 'dzin thams cad mngon par ma dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na ting nge 'dzin thams cad mngon par ma dmigs pa yin te /
translated: It is the samādhi standing in which all samādhis are non-apprehended.

original: de'i phyir mngon par ma dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon par ma dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is called the samādhi called ‘non-apprehending’.

original: de la rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the samādhi called ‘possessing the highest of all aspects’?

original: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na ting nge 'dzin thams cad rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na ting nge 'dzin thams cad rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: It is the samādhi standing in which all samādhis possess the highest of all aspects.

original: de'i phyir rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is called the samādhi called ‘possessing the highest of all aspects’.

original: de la bde ba dang sdug bsngal thams cad la mngon par dga' ba med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la bde ba dang sdug bsngal thams cad la mngon par dga' ba med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the samādhi called ‘not delighting in all happiness and suffering’?

original: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na /
translated: It is the samādhi standing in which

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal thams cad yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal thams cad yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste /
translated: It is the samādhi called ‘non-apprehending of all happiness and suffering.’

original: de'i phyir bde ba dang / sdug bsngal thams cad la mngon par dga' ba med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bde ba dang / sdug bsngal thams cad la mngon par dga' ba med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is called the samādhi called ‘non-apprehending of all happiness and suffering.’

original: de la zad mi shes pa'i za ma tog ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /🔽ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas ni ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi @234a *//
analyzed: de la zad mi shes pa'i za ma tog ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na / ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas ni ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi @234a *//
translated: “What is the samādhi called inexhaustible casket?

original: zad pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste /
analyzed: zad pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste /
translated: It is the samādhi standing in which they do not see the exhaustion of any samādhi.

original: de'i phyir zad mi shes pa'i za ma tog ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zad mi shes pa'i za ma tog ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is called the samādhi called inexhaustible casket.

original: de la gzungs kyi blo gros zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la gzungs kyi blo gros zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the samādhi called dhāraṇī intelligence?

original: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na gzungs thams cad 'dzin par byed pa ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na gzungs thams cad 'dzin par byed pa ste /
translated: It is the samādhi standing in which they hold all dhāraṇīs.

original: de'i phyir gzungs kyi blo gros zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzungs kyi blo gros zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is called the samādhi called dhāraṇī intelligence.

original: de la yang dag pa dang log pa thams cad yang dag par sel ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la yang dag pa dang log pa thams cad yang dag par sel ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: “What, you may wonder, is the samādhi called eliminating all that is correct and incorrect?

original: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi yang dag pa nyid dang log pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste; de'i phyir yang dag pa dang log pa thams cad yang dag par sel ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi yang dag pa nyid dang log pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste; de'i phyir yang dag pa dang log pa thams cad yang dag par sel ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin
translated: When you rest in this samādhi, you do not see the correctness or incorrectness of any samādhi. Therefore it is called the samādhi called eliminating all that is correct and incorrect.

original: ces bya'o // de la 'gal ba dang 'gog pa thams cad yang dag par zhi bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: ces bya'o // de la 'gal ba dang 'gog pa thams cad yang dag par zhi bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: “What, you may wonder, is the samādhi called pacifying all conflict and cessation?

original: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi 'gal ba dang / 'gog pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi 'gal ba dang / 'gog pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste /
translated: When you rest in this samādhi, you do not see the conflict or cessation of any samādhi.

original: de'i phyir 'gal ba dang 'gog pa thams cad yang dag par zhi bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gal ba dang 'gog pa thams cad yang dag par zhi bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is called the samādhi called pacifying all conflict and cessation.

original: de la mthun pa dang 'gal ba med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la mthun pa dang 'gal ba med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the samādhi called non-conflict with what is agreeable and disagreeable?

original: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na chos thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi mthun pa dang 'gal ba med pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na chos thams cad dang / ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi mthun pa dang 'gal ba med pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ste /
translated: It is the samādhi standing in which one does not see any conflict with what is agreeable and disagreeable in all dharmas and all samādhis.

original: de'i phyir mthun pa dang 'gal ba med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mthun pa dang 'gal ba med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is called the samādhi called non-conflict with what is agreeable and disagreeable.

original: de @234b la 'od dri ma med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /🔽ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na /
analyzed: de @234b la 'od dri ma med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na / ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na /
translated: What is the samādhi called stainless light?

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi 'od kyi dkyil 'khor mi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi 'od kyi dkyil 'khor mi dmigs pa ste /
translated: It is the samādhi standing in which one does not apprehend the orb of light of all samādhis.

original: de'i phyir 'od dri ma med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'od dri ma med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is called the samādhi called stainless light.

original: de la snying po dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la snying po dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the samādhi called having essence?

original: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na ting nge 'dzin thams cad snying po med par mi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na ting nge 'dzin thams cad snying po med par mi dmigs pa ste /
translated: When one abides in this samādhi, all samādhis are non-apprehended as having no essence.

original: de'i phyir snying po dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir snying po dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is called the “having an essence” samādhi.

original: de la zla ba nya ba'i 'od dri ma med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /🔽ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: de la zla ba nya ba'i 'od dri ma med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na / ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: “What is the ‘stainless light of the full moon’ samādhi?🔽When one abides in this samādhi, it is like the full moon’s orb.

original: zla ba nya ba'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ltar ting nge 'dzin thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: zla ba nya ba'i zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ltar ting nge 'dzin thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: All samādhis are perfected.

original: de'i phyir zla ba nya pa'i 'od dri ma med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zla ba nya pa'i 'od dri ma med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is called the ‘stainless light of the full moon’ samādhi.

original: de la bkod pa chen po zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la bkod pa chen po zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the ‘great array’ samādhi?

original: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na ting nge 'dzin thams cad bkod pa chen po dang ldan par 'gyur pa ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na ting nge 'dzin thams cad bkod pa chen po dang ldan par 'gyur pa ste /
translated: When one abides in this samādhi, all samādhis are endowed with a great array.

original: de'i phyir bkod pa chen po zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bkod pa chen po zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is called the samādhi called Great Array.

original: de la rnam pa thams cad du 'od byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rnam pa thams cad du 'od byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the samādhi called Illumination of All Aspects?

original: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / chos thams cad snang bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na ting nge 'dzin thams cad dang / chos thams cad snang bar byed pa ste /
translated: It is the samādhi standing in which they illuminate all samādhis and all dharmas.

original: de'i phyir rnam pa thams cad du 'od byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa thams cad du 'od byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is called the samādhi called Illumination of All Aspects.

original: de la ting nge 'dzin mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /🔽ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na ting nge 'dzin thams cad la rnam par @235a *//
analyzed: de la ting nge 'dzin mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na / ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na ting nge 'dzin thams cad la rnam par @235a *//
translated: “What is the samādhi called Equality of Samādhis?

original: g-yeng ba dang / rtse gcig par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong pa ste /
analyzed: g-yeng ba dang / rtse gcig par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong pa ste /
translated: It is the samādhi standing in which they do not see any distraction or one-pointedness in any samādhi.

original: de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ting nge 'dzin mnyam pa nyid ces bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is called the samādhi called Equality of Samādhis.

original: de la nyon mongs pa med par yang dag par 'du ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la nyon mongs pa med par yang dag par 'du ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the samādhi called “correct placement without affliction”?

original: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na ting nge 'dzin thams cad nyon mongs pa med par byed pa ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na ting nge 'dzin thams cad nyon mongs pa med par byed pa ste /
translated: It is the samādhi standing in which they make all samādhis free from affliction.

original: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa med par yang dag par 'du ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa med par yang dag par 'du ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is called the samādhi called “correct placement without affliction.”

original: de la sgra med pa dang / sgra dang bcas pa thams cad yang dag par 'du ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sgra med pa dang / sgra dang bcas pa thams cad yang dag par 'du ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the samādhi called “the correct placement of all sounds and the soundless”?

original: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na ting nge 'dzin thams cad sgra mi 'byin pa ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na ting nge 'dzin thams cad sgra mi 'byin pa ste /
translated: It is the samādhi standing in which they make all sounds in all samādhis soundless.

original: de'i phyir sgra med pa dang / sgra dang bcas pa thams cad yang dag par 'du ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgra med pa dang / sgra dang bcas pa thams cad yang dag par 'du ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is called the samādhi called “the correct placement of all sounds and the soundless.”

original: de la gnas la brtan pa med pa la brtson pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la gnas la brtan pa med pa la brtson pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the samādhi called “the effort of stability in the unstable”?

original: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na /
translated: The samādhi named Unwavering.🔽The samādhi named Unwavering is the samādhi in which all samādhis are unwavering.🔽Therefore it is called the samādhi named Unwavering.🔽The samādhi named Unattached to the World.🔽The samādhi named Unattached to the World is the samādhi in which all samādhis are unattached to the world.🔽Therefore it is called the samādhi named Unattached to the World.🔽The samādhi named Unattached to the World.

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi gnas mi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi gnas mi dmigs pa ste /
translated: The samādhi named Unattached to the World is the samādhi in which all samādhis are unattached to the world.🔽Therefore it is called the samādhi named Unattached to the World.🔽The samādhi named Unattached to the World.🔽The samādhi named Unattached to the World is the samādhi in which all samādhis are unattached to the world.🔽Therefore it is called the samādhi named Unattached to the World.

original: de'i phyir gnas la brtan pa med pa la brtson pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnas la brtan pa med pa la brtson pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
translated: The samādhi named Unattached to the World.🔽The samādhi named Unattached to the World is the samādhi in which all samādhis are unattached to the world.

original: de la de bzhin nyid la gnas shing sems med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /🔽ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na /
analyzed: de la de bzhin nyid la gnas shing sems med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na / ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na /
translated: Therefore it is called the samādhi named Unattached to the World.🔽The samādhi named Unattached to the World.

original: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid las mi ldog pa ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid las mi ldog pa ste /
translated: The samādhi named Unattached to the World is the samādhi in which all samādhis are unattached to the world.🔽Therefore it is called the samādhi named Unattached to the World.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin nyid la gnas shing sems med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin nyid la gnas shing sems med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
translated: The samādhi named Unattached to the World.🔽The samādhi named Unattached to the World is the samādhi in which all samādhis are unattached to the world.

original: de la lus kyi skyon yang dag par sel ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la lus kyi skyon yang dag par sel ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: Therefore it is called the samādhi named Unattached to the World.🔽The samādhi named Unattached to the World.

original: ting @235b nge 'dzin gang la gnas na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi lus mi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: ting @235b nge 'dzin gang la gnas na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi lus mi dmigs pa ste /
translated: The samādhi named Unattached to the World is the samādhi in which all samādhis are unattached to the world.🔽Therefore it is called the samādhi named Unattached to the World.🔽The samādhi named Unattached to the World.🔽The samādhi named Unattached to the World is the samādhi in which all samādhis are unattached to the world.🔽Therefore it is called the samādhi named Unattached to the World.

original: de'i phyir lus kyi skyon yang dag par sel ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir lus kyi skyon yang dag par sel ba zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
translated: The samādhi named Unattached to the World.

original: de la ngag gi skyon rnam par 'jig pas nam mkha' ltar gyur pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la ngag gi skyon rnam par 'jig pas nam mkha' ltar gyur pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the samādhi called “like space” because it destroys the faults of speech?

original: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi ngag gi las mi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi ngag gi las mi dmigs pa ste /
translated: It is the samādhi standing in which all verbal actions of all samādhis are not apprehended.

original: de'i phyir ngag gi skyon rnam par 'jig pas nam mkha' ltar gyur pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ngag gi skyon rnam par 'jig pas nam mkha' ltar gyur pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is called the samādhi called “like space” because it destroys the faults of speech.

original: de la nam mkha' ltar chags pa med pas rnam par grol zhing gos pa med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la nam mkha' ltar chags pa med pas rnam par grol zhing gos pa med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the samādhi called “liberation through nonattachment like space”?

original: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na chos thams cad nam mkha' ltar chags pa med pas rnam par grol zhing gos pa med pa rjes su 'thob pa ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang la gnas na chos thams cad nam mkha' ltar chags pa med pas rnam par grol zhing gos pa med pa rjes su 'thob pa ste /
translated: It is the samādhi standing in which one attains liberation through nonattachment like space with regard to all dharmas.

original: de'i phyir nam mkha' ltar chags pa med pas rnam par grol zhing gos pa med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir nam mkha' ltar chags pa med pas rnam par grol zhing gos pa med pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya ste /
translated: Therefore it is called the samādhi called “liberation through nonattachment like space.”

original: rab 'byor / de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i theg pa chen po yin no //🔽shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ni byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'i theg pa chen po yin no // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa las /
translated: This, Subhūti, is the Great Vehicle of the bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi le'u zhes bya ste bco lnga pa'o ////
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi le'u zhes bya ste bco lnga pa'o ////
translated: This was the fifteenth chapter, “Concentration,” of “The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines.”

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa khri brgyad stong pa /
translated: The Perfection of Wisdom in Eighteen Thousand Lines

original: bam po bcu gnyis pa /🔽rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni /
analyzed: bam po bcu gnyis pa / rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po'i theg pa chen po ni /
translated: Twelfth Section

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, the Great Vehicle of bodhisattva great beings is as follows:

original: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar bzhag pa bzhi ste /
translated: It is the four establishments of mindfulness.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: lus dran pa nye bar bzhag pa dang / tshor ba dran pa nye bar bzhag @236a *//
analyzed: lus dran pa nye bar bzhag pa dang / tshor ba dran pa nye bar bzhag @236a *//
translated: The establishment of mindfulness on the body, the establishment of mindfulness on feeling,

original: pa dang / sems dran pa nye bar bzhag pa dang / chos dran pa nye bar bzhag pa'o //
analyzed: pa dang / sems dran pa nye bar bzhag pa dang / chos dran pa nye bar bzhag pa'o //
translated: the establishment of mindfulness on mind, and the establishment of mindfulness on dharmas.

original: de la lus dran pa nye bar bzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la lus dran pa nye bar bzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the establishment of mindfulness on the body?

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtun pa shes bzhin can /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtun pa shes bzhin can /
translated: Subhūti, here bodhisattva great beings who are diligent, introspective, and mindful,

original: dran pa dang ldan pas 'jig rten la brnab sems dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal nas /
analyzed: dran pa dang ldan pas 'jig rten la brnab sems dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal nas /
translated: having cleared away worldly covetousness and depression,

original: nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te //
analyzed: nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te //
translated: dwell observing the internal body as body.

original: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas shing /
analyzed: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas shing /
translated: And they do so without apprehending anything.

original: lus dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams la'ang rnam par mi rtog go /🔽phyi'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas /
analyzed: lus dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams la'ang rnam par mi rtog go / phyi'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas /
translated: They also do not conceptualize the concepts associated with the body.🔽They dwell observing the external body as body.

original: nang dang phyi'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
analyzed: nang dang phyi'i lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
translated: They dwell observing the internal and external body as body.

original: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas shing /
analyzed: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas shing /
translated: And they do so without apprehending anything.

original: lus dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams la'ang rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: lus dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams la'ang rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: They also do not conceptualize the concepts associated with the body.

original: rtun pa shes bzhin can dran pa dang ldan pas 'jig rten la brnab sems dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal nas /
analyzed: rtun pa shes bzhin can dran pa dang ldan pas 'jig rten la brnab sems dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal nas /
translated: Diligent, introspective, and mindful, they clear away worldly covetousness and depression,

original: nang gi tshor ba rnams dang / sems dang / nang gi chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
analyzed: nang gi tshor ba rnams dang / sems dang / nang gi chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
translated: They abide observing inner feelings, mind, and inner phenomena.

original: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas shing chos dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams la'ang rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas shing chos dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams la'ang rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: They abide in that way without apprehending anything and do not conceptualize in a way that is associated with phenomena.

original: phyi rol gyi tshor ba rnams dang / sems dang / chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi tshor ba rnams dang / sems dang / chos rnams la chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
translated: They abide observing outer feelings, mind, and phenomena.

original: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas shing chos dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams la'ang rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas shing chos dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams la'ang rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: They abide in that way without apprehending anything and do not conceptualize in a way that is associated with phenomena.

original: nang dang phyi'i tshor ba rnams dang / sems dang / chos @236b rnams la'ang chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /🔽de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas shing /
analyzed: nang dang phyi'i tshor ba rnams dang / sems dang / chos @236b rnams la'ang chos kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te / de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas shing /
translated: They abide observing inner and outer feelings, mind, and phenomena.

original: chos dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams la'ang rnam par mi rtog go /
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams la'ang rnam par mi rtog go /
translated: They abide in that way without apprehending anything and do not conceptualize in a way that is associated with phenomena.

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ji ltar na nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas she na /
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ji ltar na nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas she na /
translated: “Subhūti, how do bodhisattva great beings stand watching their own bodies in their own bodies?

original: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di la byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings stand watching their own bodies in their own bodies,

original: spyod na'ang spyod par rab tu shes so //🔽'greng na'ang bdag 'greng bar rab tu shes so //🔽'dug na'ang bdag 'dug par rab tu shes so //
analyzed: spyod na'ang spyod par rab tu shes so // 'greng na'ang bdag 'greng bar rab tu shes so // 'dug na'ang bdag 'dug par rab tu shes so //
translated: and when they are walking they know they are walking;🔽when they are standing they know they are standing;🔽when they are sitting they know they are sitting;

original: nyal na'ang bdag nyal bar rab tu shes so //
analyzed: nyal na'ang bdag nyal bar rab tu shes so //
translated: when they are lying down they know they are lying down.

original: de'i lus ji lta ji lta bur gnas par gyur pa de lta de lta bur de rab tu shes te /
analyzed: de'i lus ji lta ji lta bur gnas par gyur pa de lta de lta bur de rab tu shes te /
translated: Whatever their body is like, it is just like that.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtun pa shes bzhin can dran pa dang ldan pas 'jig rten la brnab sems dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal nas /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtun pa shes bzhin can dran pa dang ldan pas 'jig rten la brnab sems dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal nas /
translated: Subhūti, in that way bodhisattva great beings who are diligent, introspective, and mindful, having cleared away worldly covetousness and depression,

original: nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so //
analyzed: nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so //
translated: stand watching their own bodies in their own bodies.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa de 'gro'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas pa de 'gro'am /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, when a bodhisattva mahāsattva is observing the internal body and remaining,

original: ldog kyang shes bzhin du spyod pa yin /
analyzed: ldog kyang shes bzhin du spyod pa yin /
translated: whether going or returning, he is practicing with awareness.

original: kun tu lta'am /
analyzed: kun tu lta'am /
translated: Whether looking all around

original: rnam par lta'ang shes bzhin du spyod pa yin /
analyzed: rnam par lta'ang shes bzhin du spyod pa yin /
translated: or looking in detail, he is practicing with awareness.🔽Whether bending or stretching,🔽whether carrying his Dharma robes, alms bowl, and outer robes,🔽whether eating, drinking, chewing, or tasting,

original: bskum pa dang / brkyang ba dang / snam sbyar dang / lhung bzed dang / chos gos thogs pa dang / za ba dang / 'thung ba dang / 'cha' ba dang / myang ba dang / nyal ba dang / gnyid kyis non pa bsal ba dang /
analyzed: bskum pa dang / brkyang ba dang / snam sbyar dang / lhung bzed dang / chos gos thogs pa dang / za ba dang / 'thung ba dang / 'cha' ba dang / myang ba dang / nyal ba dang / gnyid kyis non pa bsal ba dang /
translated: whether lying down, or removing sleepiness and fatigue,🔽whether coming or going, standing or sitting,🔽whether sleeping or not sleeping, whether speaking or silent,

original: @237a *// 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba dang / 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba dang / mi nyal ba dang / smra ba dang / mi smra ba dang / nang du yang dag 'jog pa na'ang shes bzhin du spyod pa yin te /
analyzed: @237a *// 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba dang / 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba dang / mi nyal ba dang / smra ba dang / mi smra ba dang / nang du yang dag 'jog pa na'ang shes bzhin du spyod pa yin te /
translated: whether in meditative equipoise or not, he is practicing with awareness.

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
translated: In this way, Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom observes the internal body,

original: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas so //
analyzed: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas so //
translated: and he does so without apprehending anything.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dran bzhin du dbugs brngubs na dran bzhin du dbugs brngubs par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dran bzhin du dbugs brngubs na dran bzhin du dbugs brngubs par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, when the bodhisattva mahāsattva breathes in mindfully, he knows accurately, ‘I am breathing in mindfully.’

original: dran bzhin du dbugs phyung na dran bzhin du dbugs phyung bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: dran bzhin du dbugs phyung na dran bzhin du dbugs phyung bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: When he breathes out mindfully, he knows accurately, ‘I am breathing out mindfully.’

original: dbugs ring du brngubs na /🔽dbugs ring du brngubs par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: dbugs ring du brngubs na / dbugs ring du brngubs par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: When he breathes in deeply,🔽he knows accurately, ‘I am breathing in deeply.’

original: dbugs ring du phyung na dbugs ring du phyung bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: dbugs ring du phyung na dbugs ring du phyung bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: When he breathes out deeply, he knows accurately, ‘I am breathing out deeply.’

original: dbugs thung ngu brngubs na dbugs thung ngu brngubs par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: dbugs thung ngu brngubs na dbugs thung ngu brngubs par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: When he breathes out a short breath, he knows “I am breathing out a short breath.”🔽When he breathes in a long breath, he knows “I am breathing in a long breath.”🔽When he breathes out a long breath, he knows “I am breathing out a long breath.”🔽When he breathes in a short breath, he knows “I am breathing in a short breath.”

original: dbugs thung du phyung na dbugs thung du phyung bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: dbugs thung du phyung na dbugs thung du phyung bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: When he breathes out a short breath, he knows “I am breathing out a short breath.”

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na / rdza mkhan nam /
analyzed: dper na / rdza mkhan nam /
translated: for example, a skilled potter

original: rdza mkhan gyi slob ma mkhas pa phang lo bskor ba ni ring du srub na'ang ring du srub bar rab tu shes so //
analyzed: rdza mkhan gyi slob ma mkhas pa phang lo bskor ba ni ring du srub na'ang ring du srub bar rab tu shes so //
translated: or a potter’s apprentice, when turning a long wheel, knows “I am turning a long wheel,”

original: thung ngu srub na'ang thung ngu srub par rab tu @237b shes so //
analyzed: thung ngu srub na'ang thung ngu srub par rab tu @237b shes so //
translated: and when turning a short wheel, knows “I am turning a short wheel.”

original: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni dran bzhin du dbugs brngubs na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po ni dran bzhin du dbugs brngubs na /
translated: Subhūti, in the same way, when a bodhisattva mahāsattva breathes in,

original: dran bzhin du dbugs brngubs par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: dran bzhin du dbugs brngubs par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: he knows “I am breathing in” and breathes out,

original: dran bzhin du dbugs phyung na dran bzhin du dbugs phyung bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //🔽dbugs ring du brngubs na dbugs ring du brngubs par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: dran bzhin du dbugs phyung na dran bzhin du dbugs phyung bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so // dbugs ring du brngubs na dbugs ring du brngubs par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: When breathing in long, he knows “I am breathing in long”;🔽when breathing out long, he knows “I am breathing out long”;🔽when breathing in short, he knows “I am breathing in short”;

original: dbugs ring du phyung na dbugs ring du phyung bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //🔽dbugs thung ngu brngubs na /🔽dbugs thung ngu brngubs par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: dbugs ring du phyung na dbugs ring du phyung bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so // dbugs thung ngu brngubs na / dbugs thung ngu brngubs par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: when breathing out short, he knows “I am breathing out short. ”🔽He trains like this: experiencing the whole body I will breathe in,🔽he trains like this: experiencing the whole body I will breathe out;

original: dbugs thung ngu phyung na /
analyzed: dbugs thung ngu phyung na /

analyzed: dbugs thung ngu phyung bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtun pa shes bzhin can /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtun pa shes bzhin can /

analyzed: dran pa dang ldan pas 'jig rten la brnab sems dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal nas /

original: nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
analyzed: nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /

analyzed: de'ang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas so //

analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lus 'di nyid la khams kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rtog par byed de / lus 'di la ni sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams yod do //
translated: “Moreover, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings investigate this very body according to the elements,

original: snyam du rtog go /
analyzed: snyam du rtog go /
translated: thinking, ‘In this body there is the earth element, the water element, the fire element, and the wind element.’

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /🔽dper na / ba lang gsod pa'am /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste / dper na / ba lang gsod pa'am /
translated: “Subhūti, it is like this:🔽For example, a butcher

original: ba @238a *// lang gsod pa'i slob ma mkhas pas /
analyzed: ba @238a *// lang gsod pa'i slob ma mkhas pas /
translated: or a butcher’s apprentice

original: mtshon rnon pos ba lang bsad nas bag bzhir bshags te /
analyzed: mtshon rnon pos ba lang bsad nas bag bzhir bshags te /
translated: kills a cow and divides it into four parts.

original: gzug bzhir phye nas /
analyzed: gzug bzhir phye nas /
translated: Having divided it into four parts,

original: 'greng ngam 'dug ste so sor rtog pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'greng ngam 'dug ste so sor rtog pa de bzhin du /
translated: he stands or sits and observes each part.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'ang lus 'di nyid la khams kyis so sor rtog par byed de /🔽lus 'di la ni sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams yod do //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'ang lus 'di nyid la khams kyis so sor rtog par byed de / lus 'di la ni sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams yod do //
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom also investigate this very body with its elements.

original: snyam du so sor rtog ste /
analyzed: snyam du so sor rtog ste /
translated: They investigate it, thinking, ‘In this body there are the earth element, the water element, the fire element, and the wind element.’

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'ang 'greng ngam 'dug kyang nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa'ang 'greng ngam 'dug kyang nang gi lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas te /
translated: “Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom, standing or sitting, watch the body in the body and dwell on it,

original: de dang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas so //
analyzed: de dang mi dmigs pa'i tshul gyis gnas so //
translated: and they do so without apprehending anything.

original: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni lus 'di nyid la rkang pa'i mthil yan chad /
analyzed: rab 'byor gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni lus 'di nyid la rkang pa'i mthil yan chad /
translated: “Furthermore, Subhūti, bodhisattva great beings practicing the perfection of wisdom investigate this very body, from the soles of the feet up,

original: skra dang mgo bo man chad na sen mo dang / spu dang / pags pa la thug pa'i bar du mi gtsang ba sna tshogs kyis gang bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rtog ste /
analyzed: skra dang mgo bo man chad na sen mo dang / spu dang / pags pa la thug pa'i bar du mi gtsang ba sna tshogs kyis gang bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rtog ste /
translated: From the head down to the nails, from the hair down to the skin, the body is filled with all kinds of impurities.

original: lus 'di la ni skra dang / spu dang / sen mo dang / so dang / pags shun dang / sha dang / rgyus pa dang / khrag dang / rus pa dang / rkang dang / snying dang / mkhal ma dang / mchin pa dang /

translated: This body is full of hair of the head, body hair, nails, teeth, skin, flesh, sinews, blood, bones, bone marrow, kidneys, heart, liver,

original: glo ba dang / mtsher pa dang / long ka dang / rgyu ma dang / gnye ma dang / lgang @238b pa dang / gcin dang / phyi sa dang / mchi ma dang / rngul dang / tshil dang / snabs dang / ngar snabs dang /

original: rnag dang / mkhris pa dang / bad kan dang / zhag dang / chu ser dang / dri ma dang / mgo bo dang; klad pa dang / mig rdul dang / rna spabs dag yod par lus 'di la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rtog go /

translated: He examines this body correctly, as it is, and sees that it is full of pus, bile, phlegm, grease, fat, blood, sweat, tears, mucus, saliva, synovial fluid, urine, feces, head hairs, body hairs, nails, and brain matter.

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: “Subhūti, it is like this:🔽A farmer’s granary is full of various grains, such as rice, barley, sesame, beans, lentils, chickpeas, mustard seeds, wheat, and white mustard seeds.

original: dper na / zhing pa'i sbyang 'bras so ba dang / 'bru dang / til dang / 'bras drus dang / mon sran sde'u dang / mon sran gre'u dang / sran chung dang / nas dang / gro dang / yungs 'bru dang / 'bru sna tshogs kyis gang ba mig dang ldan pa'i mis phye ste /

translated: A person with eyes, having opened it and examined it,

analyzed: brtags na / 'di ltar 'di ni 'bras so ba yin no // 'di ni 'bru yin no //
translated: would think, ‘This is rice.🔽This is barley.

analyzed: 'di ni til yin no // 'di ni 'bras drus yin no //

analyzed: 'di ni mon sran sde'u yin no // 'di ni mon sran gre'u yin no //

original: 'di ni sran chung yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni sran chung yin no //
translated: This is wheat.🔽This is white mustard seeds.’

original: 'di ni nas yin no //🔽'di ni gro yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni nas yin no // 'di ni gro yin no //
translated: This is barley.🔽This is wheat.

original: 'di ni yungs 'bru yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni yungs 'bru yin no //
translated: This is mustard seed.

original: snyam du shes so //🔽rab 'byor / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po lus 'di nyid la rkang pa'i mthil yan chad /

translated: Thus he knows.🔽Subhūti, in the same way, the bodhisattva mahāsattva, in this very body, from the soles of the feet upward,🔽

original: skra dang mgo bo man chad sen mo dang / spu dang / pags pa la thug gi bar du mi gtsang ba sna tshogs kyis gang bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rtog ste /
analyzed: skra dang mgo bo man chad sen mo dang / spu dang / pags pa la thug gi bar du mi gtsang ba sna tshogs kyis gang bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du so sor rtog ste /
translated: “Subhūti, in the same way, great bodhisattva beings discern this very body, from the soles of the feet upwards and from the hair and head downwards, as full of various impurities,🔽as far as the tips of the nails, the body hair, the skin, and the flesh.

original: lus 'di la ni skra dang / spu dang / sen mo dang / so dang / pags shun dang / sha dang / rgyus pa dang / khrag dang / rus pa dang / rkang dang / snying dang / mkhal ma dang / mchin pa dang /
analyzed: lus 'di la ni skra dang / spu dang / sen mo dang / so dang / pags shun dang / sha dang / rgyus pa dang / khrag dang / rus pa dang / rkang dang / snying dang / mkhal ma dang / mchin pa dang /
translated: In this body there is hair of the head, body hair, nails, teeth, skin, flesh, sinews, bones, marrow, kidneys, heart, liver,

original: glo ba dang / @239a *//
analyzed: glo ba dang / @239a *//
translated: lungs,

original: mtsher pa dang / long ka dang / rgyu ma dang / gnye ma dang / lgang pa dang / gcin dang / phyi sa dang / mchi ma dang / rdul dang / tshil dang / snabs dang / dar snabs dang / rnag dang; mkhris pa dang /🔽bad kan dang / zhag dang / chu ser dang / dri ma dang / mgo bo dang / klad pa dang / mig rdul dang / rna spabs dag yod do //
analyzed: mtsher pa dang / long ka dang / rgyu ma dang / gnye ma dang / lgang pa dang / gcin dang / phyi sa dang / mchi ma dang / rdul dang / tshil dang / snabs dang / dar snabs dang / rnag dang; mkhris pa dang / bad kan dang / zhag dang / chu ser dang / dri ma dang / mgo bo dang / klad pa dang / mig rdul dang / rna spabs dag yod do //
translated: the liver, the spleen, the intestines, the mesentery, the stomach, the kidneys, the undigested food, the feces, the tears, the sweat, the grease, the spittle, the mucus, the pus, the blood,

analyzed: snyam du rtog go /

analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa /

translated: Endowed with mindfulness, he dwells having eliminated worldly covetousness and dejection, and he observes the body as a body.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gi tshe /🔽dur khrod du keng rus sha dang khrag med cing rgyus pas ma 'brel ba /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gi tshe / dur khrod du keng rus sha dang khrag med cing rgyus pas ma 'brel ba /
translated: Moreover, Subhūti, when a bodhisattva mahāsattva🔽sees in a charnel ground skeletons without flesh and blood, not connected by tendons,

original: dung gi mdog ltar gyur pa dag ma thong ba na /
analyzed: dung gi mdog ltar gyur pa dag ma thong ba na /
translated: the color of a conch shell,

original: de lus 'di'ang 'di lta bu'i chos can dang / 'di lta bu'i rang bzhin can yin te /🔽chos nyid de dang ma bral ba yin no //
analyzed: de lus 'di'ang 'di lta bu'i chos can dang / 'di lta bu'i rang bzhin can yin te / chos nyid de dang ma bral ba yin no //
translated: he applies this very body to that principle and that nature,

original: zhes lus 'di nyid kyang tshul de @240b dang sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: zhes lus 'di nyid kyang tshul de @240b dang sbyor bar byed do //
translated: thinking, “This body also has that nature and is not separate from that principle.”

original: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtun ba shes bzhin can /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rtun ba shes bzhin can /
translated: In that way, Subhūti, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who is energetic, has established mindfulness,

original: dran pa dang ldan pas 'jig rten la brnab sems dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal nas /
analyzed: dran pa dang ldan pas 'jig rten la brnab sems dang / yid mi bde ba rnam par bsal nas /
translated: and is endowed with alertness and mindfulness, eliminates worldly covetousness and dejection,🔽and

original: lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so //
analyzed: lus la lus kyi rjes su lta zhing gnas so //
translated: He dwells watching the body as body,

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gi tshe /🔽dur khrod du keng rus zungs med cing gyes te /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gi tshe / dur khrod du keng rus zungs med cing gyes te /
translated: “Moreover, Subhūti, when a bodhisattva mahāsattva🔽sees in a charnel ground skeletons without joints,

original: dung sa la gtor ba lta bu dag mthong ba na /
analyzed: dung sa la gtor ba lta bu dag mthong ba na /
translated: scattered like the scattering of grain,

original: de lus 'di'ang 'di lta bu'i chos can dang / 'di lta bu'i rang bzhin can yin te /
analyzed: de lus 'di'ang 'di lta bu'i chos can dang / 'di lta bu'i rang bzhin can yin te /
translated: he thinks, ‘This body also has such a nature and such a condition,

original: chos nyid de dang ma bral ba yin no //
analyzed: chos nyid de dang ma bral ba yin no //
translated: and is not free from such a reality.’
